S5dWqbNBnOlmsHU80LPmmw.text: I came in expecting the food and service to be good, but not nearly as good as it was! My server, Sebastian, did a great job. He was funny and checked on us consistently without being overbearing. The food was amazing, I've never tasted anything so good. I definitely plan on coming back!!

wCWaWTImDQHBpczCG26aYQ.text: Great place.  Food, entertainment and service was great.  We had the calamari for appetizer and for dinner we had the fettucini alfredo with sausage and Pesce Misto.  Delicious! Must try.  We will definitely be back.  Happy Hour until 7 pm!

DBuFcUPplpV461wjc8dxDA.text: Sat at the bar for a casual drink and dinner. Bartenders acted friendly but were  not attentive, unless you were a regular.  Ordered burrata and after almost 25 minutes waiting I was brought something that looked like a fish. Obviously the bartender entered wrong item. It happens. But not one apology. Eventually got my burrata and it was nothing special. Heirloom tomato was very soft. All in all, too many choices in Vegas to settle for the food and service I received this night.

JiUjb7q1tw0mS9fVA5WWBw.text: The room feels slightly empty, but it's still a decent place to go for dinner. Not really a "date night" feel.   The food is 3.5 star. Most of their dishes come with home made pasta. Their meats and cheeses are said to be aged and cured in house- which were delicious. Their desserts need some work. We ordered the tiramisu, which lacked the rum, so it was dry, a banana split that was made with gelato and the canolis. The cream in the canolis had too much citrus, it was overwhelming.   The bar has several different types of wine, but they don't know how to make an old fashion. When I described it, they literally threw an orange slice and a cherry into a big glass of bourbon.   The reason for the 4 star was because of Pasquale.  He makes this restaurant. His service is so personalized and so genuine. Although it wasn't busy, he made us feel like the only table in the restaurant. We will come back because of him.

V1lShA5L_4rywo014OWqOQ.text: Any restaurant that gives out 4 different menus to order from has a problem.  I had the lamb chops which were over cooked. The Quiche was microwaved. The cheesecake topping was so hard from sitting around it was literally tough to cut. News 3 mentioned if you order brunch you get a comp mimosa. Partial truth. Only one per table.  What a joke.  The fact that it was dead should have been our indication to go elsewhere

Xl0hUEdAeQTBFwEVBJFRkw.text: Las Vegas has roughly 5000 delis- this is one of the best.  Half of the building is an upscale restaurant and half is a grocery/deli you can dine in- immediately turn to your right upon entering to to to this section. The other half is basically for upscale dinner-quality dates.  The bakery-deli-grocery has everything you could possibly need from fresh pastas to calamari salad to real canned peeled San Marzano tomatoes for kitchen adventures and more marinated artichokes, olives, and peppers than you can shake a stick at.  Order at the back counter for takeout or dine-in: the first sandwich listed on the "hot" page is what you want to get. It's a chicken cutlet with spinach, fresh cheese, and God only knows what else, and it's frickin' amazing. Runner up is the Sicilian sandwich, the first listed on the "cold" page, with ham, Genoa, and mortadella with mozzarella- get it with everything on it. Fresh crunchy veggies, complementary spices and oil, and the freshest and most flavorful meats and cheeses I've yet encountered.  Both sandwiches are made with the freshest, most delightful french roll bread. Oh, and they're frickin' huge. Like half of a single sandwich is an entire meal, huge.  If that's not enough for you, there are two cases of desserts and the service is phenomenal- be sure to get the guy with the thick black-framed glasses, he's delightful! And they have both regular happy hours (3-7PM, daily) and reverse (Mon, Tues, Thurs, 9PM to close) with half price drinks and apps.

HMOJY6gaTLEpx0bsTDmrfQ.text: So I will just state that we were having an Italian themed wedding. That being said, we were looking for Italian pastries. We got together with the caterer. She was helpful and pleasant to deal with.  The day came and everything turned out perfectly. Wedding day was September 12, 2015.

M095wDqaTCQ8VmD58xu47g.text: I have been here a couple of times before during lunch time. I always got the pasta with a creamy garlic sauce and lobster, scallop, and shrimp. I usually get it substituted with angel hair pasta. I also really love the caprese salad. It was my absolute favorite Italian place with the amazing service and food. I raved about it to my husband because I usually came with a friend. We decided to come in last night for my husband's birthday dinner. He had high hopes for this place because of my description. I came in and I was so disappointed because it was supposed to be special for my husband's birthday. We were greeted by a friendly young man who graciously led us to a booth and made joke with us. He was incredibly helpful with explaining the special menu. He was the best person on staff tonight. I wish I got his name. The server, William greeted us by asking us if we wanted to start off with waters. No smile. I told him iced water would be fine for me. My husband asked if there was sparkling water so the server said 'okay' and rushed off. He came back with a large bottle of Pelligrino and began to pour in the glass in front of me. I apologized and said the sparkling water was just for my husband. He looked at me as if I was being an inconvenience to him and told the busser 'can you get water for the lady?' And the both of them rushed off. It is fine that there was a misunderstanding but I didn't appreciate how he acted like I was a big inconvenience. When he came to take our order, we ordered the bruchetta and marinara mussels for our appetizer. My husband ordered the rib eye and I had my usual pasta. We had finished up our appetizers and 3 people walked by our table multiple times each, not bothering to pick up our plates after we stacked them. We were the only ones on the restaurant side. This usually wouldn't bother me but William's unkind attitude had me in a bit of a sour mood.  Will brought out our entrees and left. He was not being friendly at all. He put me under the impression that I was being a bother to him when I did not try to cause an issue. He asked us if we wanted dessert and unfortuantely we were too full. I had thanked him and said we were full but the check would be great but he walked away in the middle of talking. It really made me annoyed because I have always spoke positively about this place but last night's experience was not good.

b1hi1o1auWud0Yd5_4VJHA.text: Wow!!I left a review on my HONEST opinion and just got SLAMMED, TROLLED BULLIED by i believe the manager, of this establishment!!! If that is how a dissatisfied customer is handled, id hate to see how your kitchen works. MARC T: 20 min late doesnt justify ICE COLD PIZZA. I ordered on NYE and picked up at 530..NO ONE was in your establishment. Figured you would get that NYE is a LATE NIGHT event and people dont show up till later. You might want to work on not only your customer service skills, but your maturity. I chose Siena because i had eaten there before and enjoyed it. Telling me "next time go get Chinese food" is insulting and extremely unprofessional and im curious as to how your bosses will react when notified...

7ab9iQKRuMsqUTg7UkbkCg.text: Great service by Josh and team!!! Quality food at great happy hour prices, a hidden gem!!!!

tkeifarL2VI0eTJjYO02dw.text: Great sangria . Loved it . The food is well cooked and delicious. I love the food and drinks . The service was kind of slow but the employees were still wonderful and nice .

G4k0gs60CULQRcUelTa3RQ.text: Spent 98 dollars on sliced meat for an event I was hosting and they didn't even bother taking the casing off half of the meat

XiotTJE3vFdegqd8FEkmWg.text: Disappointing experience, to say the least.    They were taking reservations until 10:30 p.m. on Open Table.  I made a confirmed reservation for 10:00 p.m., picked-up a family member at the airport, drove cross-town for dinner, arrived on time, but was told they were closing the kitchen at 10:00 that night.  They had "neglected" to change their operating hours on Open Table.  Now I was on the west side of the city with no other decent restaurants still open.

2rnZ2ia_Z3NrFs8TXYRv0g.text: Had such an amazing night! The live music was really nice. The service was outstanding and the food and drinks were delicious! Felt very welcomed here will definitely be coming back!

9dbCNwQ8O4t3wyAZZI0Eig.text: This is the first time that we visited this restaurant and it will be the last time. My date and I sat there for 10 minutes and no one came to even offer us water. A waiter that had been standing there the whole time had the audacity to say goodbye to us after observing us leaving the restaurant.  No one seems to care. How sad we picked this place for a date night.

ZMFMz1_yGnsf-EKFrmpLUQ.text: After living in Las Vegas for a little over four years, and hearing remarkable things about Siena, I took some out-of-town guests there for dinner last night and had a less than desirable experience. I'm not a typical restaurant complainer, but with a restaurant as well known and regarded as this one, I simply expected better.  Let me start out by saying the food (for the most part) was delicious. I will say that they offer a "create your own" cheese plate. The portions of cheese were embarrassingly small. We actually laughed when it came to the table, because I've heard that Siena is known for their cheeses.  Now for the not so good:  First of all, we visited on a Wednesday night and the restaurant was not crowded. Our waiter had to have been new. He mumbled and we could barely understand anything he said. He seemed as though he would have rather been anywhere but there. He took our drink order and about 10 minutes later, returned to let us know the bar was out of one of the flavored vodkas required for the specialty martini featured on their drink menu. We clarified our drink order, and then it took another FIFTEEN minutes to receive our cocktails. We watched them sitting on the bar for most of that fifteen minutes. We had to ask for additional bread several times before receiving it. The service was definitely lacking, and I want to think that this was just a bad night, however, this was our first impression, and will likely be our last here. I was surprised that in a restaurant of this caliber that there was no visible management presence. We never had anyone stop to ask how the evening was going, nor was there anyone visible for us to bring our concerns to.  I hope that the team at Siena can learn from this review in an effort to delight their guests in the future.

D2Y56b1wwqB4ANch28-SWw.text: I haven't written a review in a while but, I felt compelled to do so now. FYI- I visited the deli not the actual restaurant part.   My step son gave us a gift card for Christmas and I finally decided to use it. Here it goes;   I was weakly greeted upon entering.  I told them I had never been there before blah blah. I called my husband to see what he wanted. I was going to get the meatball Parmesan but, when j asked if it was good the girl said " if you like meat and cheese yes". Obviously, if I was inquiring about it duh. Anyway, I changed my order to the Sicilian (which my husband ordered while I was on the phone getting his order in front of the girl worker). I asked for no ham. We discussed it for a minute or so. I took a look around prices seem high. I ordered a coffee it was very good. They use  Lavazza Italian coffee. ( so. ?).   The kid rings up my order. I sit and wait for my food about ten more minutes and I'm thinking " God, this is taking long". I ask "is my foot ready"? Oh it was ready when you paid for it . I'm starving n I'm sitting here waiting. Really? Then, I look in the bag and I have one sandwich not two. Wtf? To be honest I would have rather gone to subway. I'll use the gift card to buy coffee there and make it at home.

60le-Oqy0W_vPGy71s1P6g.text: This place is amazing. The deli is great for lunch, and the atmosphere is awesome at night. Love music and the best bartender Josh :) I would come back just to see this guy!!

_9jJRZ7usA5DVYM8bo3akw.text: Not what I expected at all.... had the bruschetta for an appetizer... hardest bread ever and the toppings were equally as bad and completely tasteless... service was marginal... our waitress actually could benefit by having her hair tied back...  probably needs to listen to the customer...food came and seemed overdone... everyone at the table had issues with the taste and doneness of their food... was looking forward to a Saturday night dinner with friends... I would totally suggest you spend your money elsewhere...

OgZFkaDtIFq6cNK87Iy5vA.text: Consistently yummy and a good value. The wait staff and kitchen can sometimes get behind but the atmosphere and deliciousness that comes to your table makes up for it.

LjMUiK36eQHLZcJBHWSbxA.text: I love this place the food is good, ask for easy sauce on all pastas though. A bit dissapointed with not seeing my regular boys Todd and Todd - it seems theres been some staff changes. Appies and mains are great - but never had an amazing dessert.

O_C-2kZMHGnq3ZDL_OaG6Q.text: I stopped in to try the new deli over the weekend. It's been far too long since I consumed my favorite Italian eats. The sicilian and eggplant sandwiches were as good as ever before. It was great to have a fix. Pizza is still getting up and running so I'll have to make another visit soon for a slice of ricotta and spinach.

Inys09emDH_wMbq6_zxaZQ.text: I came here very excited.  I had been wanting to try this place for  forever. We were greeted by a wonderful older gentleman. Who sat us and was our server  He made us feel like family the whole time.  5 star service.  The food was excellent.  My sister got the lasagna and I ordered the chicken marsala.  She said the lasagna was excellent and I thought the chicken Marcella was fantastic as well. Our server made me feel very confident about what I had ordered because his eyes rolled up and he said that it's amazing and that he would actually have that for lunch himself that day as well.  The service was very attentive, the food was excellent  the decore is excellent ,the vibe is excellent and I would definitely go back here again.  After we were finished we went to the deli side of the restaurant and ordered sandwiches and desserts and meats to go. I have tried a little bit of all of them in again excellent quality.  The Sicilian sandwich is one to order and also the tiramisu is no joke.

6Cl_scjMAdsZNmE7vyOnuA.text: This place is great. They have great hot and cold dishes. I had the eggplant parmisan, the cheese ravioli's. They even had delicious deserts that have peanuts on the outside and are chewy on the inside.   This is also a great little grocery store where you can buy all sorts of staples. The deli looks good, I have been meaning to order some deli meat and prosciutto but have not yet. I will let you know how it is when I do, but this market and deli is amazingly perfect. They are planning to move soon which makes me sad.   I think the owners are ethnic Italians. They have the Italian channel and sometimes you can even find an old Italian musician playing an accordion and singing from time to time. Truly the coolest Italian place I have found.

Gwki5_Gf3mMnN5Vh7LoWqQ.text: Two of us ordered pastas.. I loved the pasta I ordered with tomato creamy sauce. Both were good tasting and good portion.. They have piano & bass live-music.. It's a good place to have a small date.. The service was just fine.. They have Happy Hour menu too (approx. $7-$10) but it's not as valuable as other restaurants' such as Yardhouse or Kona Grill..

YAb87DuCZyzVXSmTuD7YLA.text: The food at Siena is its strong point, and the service is always stellar. Love the lasagna, especially, but everything's good. The only fault I can find is the live music. It's a tad too loud, and not especially good. Luckily, you can sit outside! Great bread. Great cocktails. Great salads. A very enjoyable culinary experience, but the live music has got to go. It's the only reason we wouldn't go again (in the winter it'll be too cold to sit inside!). Love this joint!

3FNzzGMGen4jRx04aQ2xiw.text: I JUST HAD THE BEST LUNCH EVER!!!! CARB-TASTIC!!! I almost feel I should leave this review in two parts.....one for a take-out experience and one later for a dine-in.  Today is the Take-Out.  So, on the suggestion of the Awesome Princess Crystal Dawn.....the conversation went kinda like this : Damon : I'm hungry. Crystal : Well, I have a cure for that? Damon : Oh really? Crystal : Yes, really, Siena. Damon :  Who's that? Crystal :  It's an AWESOME Italian Deli.  ....and history was made.  I clocked out for my lunch break eager to feed on something from anywhere new.   Walking into Siena is like walking into charm.  You are automatically surrounded by deli that could easily be a movie set.  I took a number.  Ordered the days special Fettuccine and Red Sauce with Chicken and Eggplant.   Oh, and  3 canolli.  The wait was a little long, but who cares, there was just so much to take in.  The hanging sausage, the cheeses, the baked goods tempting me at the front case.   Anything and everything you could possibly want and thought you could only find in NYC.  I walk out the door lunch in hand.   As I'm driving back to work I realize I can't wait to partake of one of the canolli.   Now my roommate constantly touts the beauty of the canollli, but let me tell you, I've had a few,Vegas canolli aren't a beauty....at least until now.  All 3 found their way into my mouth before I parked my car.  Ummmm...WOW.  Why eat anything else EVER!!!  Why move on to the (what felt like 5lbs. of pasta) Fettuccine I had actually intended to be my lunch.   But I did it, and it was worth it. ( I can't believe I ate the WHOLE thing. )  Now my friends, I need a nap. Next time I'll stay and take more time.  Try that beautiful Sicilian pizza they had.  Until then  canolli wishes and spumoni dreams.  Siena Deli - FOR THE FAMILY, BY THE FAMILY

TP2mTg1FuA1Q42zEDvCZ_g.text: Bad experience night before thanksgiving. Car got keyed by front door. Credit card info swiped. And worse of all, osso bucco bad.

Y01iw3Sf_MVpJpSXSGDExw.text: Always a wonderful meal and experience when we visit Sienna.  The staff is very attentive.

u-yUcE93FIQ7Skar9Z1BUw.text: I went here for dinner with my family and was disappointed.  We got gnocchi, fish of the day (tuna), and the seafood platter.  The food just wasn't great, and for the prices I would expect higher quality.

UqgjtlY5dR-o7urbtnLYxA.text: I made a dinner reservation for a moderate size party for Christmas Eve and specifically told them that I did not want the banquet room.  However when we arrived and were seated in a somewhat isolated room away from the dinning room, I inquired about if we were in the banquet room, which our waiter denied. (the reason it annoyed me was because I was also informed that there was no "special" menu, which it WAS!) My family is a big fan of eggplant parm and they would not accommodate either. Overall, the food was 6/10, the service staff were fairly personable. I was building this place up for my friends & family and instead all I heard was an earful about their experience. We still had a Merry Christmas nonetheless. Prob won't go back.

hijRkyfaYSq2OlV1TNXKTg.text: My cutie petutie is straight from NYC and he's the biggest deli snob ever.  If he doesn't feel good about the authenticity of a deli, it is not unheard of for us to walk out.  He takes one look and knows if its legit.  Well, he loved this place.  The food tasted home cooked and the portions were huge... did I mention the reasonable prices?    I had the sausage and peppers special with a side of garlic knots.  I would definitely recommend... especially since it passed my boyfriend's sniff test.

NxseA-UdpqgrsfjT0BIRLw.text: AAAAAhhhhhhMAZING!!!!!!!!! so yummy we went there everyday we were in vegas except on sunday cause they are closed. Best cannoli I've ever had! best meatball sub....and I kinda consider myself to be a bit of a meatball sub connoisseur. However the homemade sausage pepper and onions sandwich defiantly rivaled the meatball. my brother really like their ravilois and the sicilian sandwich. great market with authentic italian fare. friendly service, fast and CHEAP!!!!!! sooooo good I want them to move to SF.

BW-EiunluyxiAqTt9IRmOQ.text: Siena is a prefectly ok suburban italian restaurant.  Service is usually very good and the atmosphere is nice.  The food can be spotty.  The bruscetta would benefit from less quantity, more quality.  I've had it a couple times and the tomatoes lack flavor.  The bread is also pre-toasted and then left to sit.  For entrees i've had veal with mushrooms.  It was pretty good but nothing too memorable.  The pastas are good (you can buy many of the ingredients at their store next to the restaurant).  Espresso is good.  Worth a visit if you're stuck on that side of town.

Ya8TQ8wh7Q4pzAY6xVHl6A.text: I used to be a fan of the deli, but not anymore. While the food is good, the service is just idiotic and completely disrespectful. You'll wait at the counter for 15 minutes while 3 employees ignore you and are too busy catching up on their tasks, forgetting that a customer is not a disturbance, but the reason for their job.  A bad experience could turn into a positive one with one and only small gesture: Let me know it will take a while or take 1 minute to take my order, so that I know you're not just wasting my time. What makes other's order so much more important than mine that you cannot even talk to me???  This is not the first time that this happened... it just gets worse each time... enough to scratch it off my list of good places. I'll just go down the street a few blocks to Roma Deli instead.

wewu2stI-Nk1WK4-FkvUFw.text: Before reading my review, take note: I didn't order anything Itaian! Went here for a business lunch meeting. I ordered one of the lunch specials,  ahi tuna, which was served with seared asparagus. Very good. Generous portion. My lunch oompanion ordered the salad with crab, which looked really good. I was impressed with the adjacent market/deli as well.  Many of the regular items on the menu seemed a bit pricey to me, but I enjoyed the atmosphere and my food was excellent.  No problem when I asked for butter sauce on the side.

Oge1MKZY-LYYvF5YVpdSNA.text: This review is for the Trattoria half of this business. I am a long time customer of the Siena Deli that was at Tropicana and Eastern. I used to eat lunch there whenever I was within 5 miles when I used to have my mobile computer repair business in Las Vegas. After I moved to Colorado I always ended my road trips to Vegas with a stop to get lunch and to purchase some sausage or other Italian meats to put in a cooler to take home with me. So when I heard that Siena closed my old favorite Deli and opened a Trattoria/Deli I couldn't wait to give it a try. Needless to say by my 3 stars that my first trip to the new place wasn't a good one, if it wasn't for the food I would have given them 1 or 2 stars and maybe my Italian anger is still too strong to write a fair review but here's what happened.   My wife had received an anniversary coupon from their email club so when we were back home on a business trip celebrating our anniversary we drove all the way up the west end of Sahara. My wife ordered the Ravioli Burro E Salvia (Cheese Raviolis on Marinara with a butter sage reduction) and I ordered the Sausage pinwheel with a side of Broccoli Rape, I always knew this as Robbies, Broccoli Rabe or Rapini. My wife loved her Raviolis and I really enjoyed the Sausage. But when I asked the waiter if they had Broccoli Rabe thinking that it might be out of season and he said yes, I was excited as it's hard to find in Denver and I love Robbies. When my meal was delivered on my plate was Broccoletti or Broccotini, I told my waiter that this was not what I ordered but he insisted that what was on my plate was "Rapini". Then to try and convince me he called over another waiter and he also argued with me saying that the Broccoletti was Broccoli Rabe or Rapini. Now, I've been eating Broccoli Rabe my entire life and know the difference between the two and getting into an argument with 2 NON-Italian waiters over what I ordered made me very angry on a night I was trying to celebrate my anniversary. I told him to tell the chef that what he served me was not Broccoli Rabe. When I finished my Sausage the waiter returned saying that the chef apologizes and offered us a dessert compliments of the house. This started to make me feel better. He took away my plate with the Broccoletti that I didn't eat and brought us our dessert.....Spumoni. On their dessert menu they described the Spumoni as chocolate, pistachio and strawberry gelato with whipped cream. What he brought was only chocolate and pistachio gelato, no whipped cream but it was very good anyway. I wasn't going to look a gift horse in the mouth and was thankful for the free dessert. Then I got the bill. They charged me $2.00 for the Broccoletti that I did not order or eat! I waited for the manager to come to the table but I guess an unhappy customer wasn't worth his time.   When I go to an "Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli" I don't want to order something "Italian" from their menu and then told by two Spanish speaking waiters that I don't know what I ordered. I predict that Sienna will go out of business if they don't hire better waiters that know about Italian foods and what is on their menu. Arguing with Italian customers in an Italian restaurant over Italian food is just plain stupid. If I wasn't with my wife I might have reacted a bit differently and the manager wouldn't have had a choice but to intervene.

2UqInm_e8o2b7gVLEmIzHg.text: This is our "go to" spot for a weekend lunch.  It's like an old Italian deli you'd find in Chicago or Highwood, IL.  Everything is fresh, homemade (oh, that bread!), sausages, pizza, the sandwiches, hot or cold,  are amazing, and the desserts are incredible.  They even have a wide variety of olives.  They have a deli side and a more upscale dining experience in their restaurant located next to the deli.  We love eating our sandwiches on the their covered porch.  Very relaxing and inviting.  Love this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parmigiana. Delish! I ate the other half before picture.

m-GhaSlCxXOao-tX3YqOyw.text: This is my favorite Italian Restaurant.  As soon as we get in we were greeted by the hostess with a smile. We were seated in front of the kitchen and you can see the cooking action.  We had Calamari for an appetizer, it was properly battered and cooked to perfection.  Had Fruti di Mari, Fettuccini Alfredo and Halibut for the entree.  It was really made fresh and with gusto.  Dessert found us with a helping of Tiramisu to share and a finale of freshly made frothing Cappuccino.  The service team of Gloria and the bus person were attentive, friendly and all smiles   We bought some items from the Deli too. Personnels were friendly likewise.  A must place to visit.

jNsXLO-eG1z9kDXPQa-N3A.text: So disappointed with my last order. The pizza wasn't that good and food is pricey but not what I expect! They used to have mushroom soup which was great but now everytime I go they don't have it! I used to like thd place. Not anymore! There are other Italian restaurants better than Siena.

IJiecM_3FITqGnFYCfusxA.text: I LOVE this place! Long overdue review! I come here all the time! It's such a beautiful place and it almost doesn't feel like you're in Vegas. I came here for dinner and sat at the restaurant once and it was great! But I come here to the bar and the little deli a million times! At the bar they have happy hour from 3-7pm and they have really good food! The lamb chops are amazing! I use the anchioade that they give with the bread and smother it all over my lamb! Yummmm! The prima salad is perfect as well! It's arugula tossed with lobster meat and a light dressing. Then it has a red and yellow tomato slice, some grilled shrimp and a fan of avocado! Yum! Those are two of my favorites! I also come here often for my coffee and sambuca Fix! And at the deli I come here often for manhattans and their hazelnut gelato TOOO DIE FORRR!!!! The cannolis are amazing! The Italian cookies are amazing! They have pizelles and so many other Italian goods! I often buy their breaded eggplant, their fresh gnocchi's and fresh marinara sauce then go home and put it all together for a wonderful Authentic Italian dinner! I can't say enough about this place! Atmosphere, friendly people and beyond delicious food!

T0g_UKwvGZFVTDUmbF7N2A.text: Order Bruscheta and Pasta Promodoro some Prosciutto on the side had two Peroni it was very good. Bartender was very nice didn't get her name thou she must be Asian or Hawaiian it is happy hour and the price is not bad at all highly recommended for some Pasta craving and kill time leisure!

80hDgp9XBXJGSlL4aQZozQ.text: What a wonderful place to relax with drinks and music!! We have been looking for a place to enjoy after dinner for drinks and music, this is the best spot in SUMMERLIN! And Gian Carlo the owner is so friendly and accommodating!! I absolutely love it here!!!

--i563XplVBDUWPMWi__Iw.text: We have gone to the restaurant, bar for happy hour and the deli.   Wish the deli had more chairs as the food is really good.   Cookies are fantastic!   Great selection of grocery items as well.  Restaurant is pretty good.   We had our work holiday party there and service was good.   Happy hour items are nice sized and you can order several items to try them out.   I just really don't like the seating.   For someone short, the high tops are WAY too high and too close together.   Its hard to climb up without hitting the table next to you.    So, like the food, service is good but seating in the bar & deli make it hard to go more often.

vyd4QaO2A1F0u2p47gaqHw.text: This review is for the deli/coffee shop: nice place, good food, horrible service!! I started my order at the register, and halfway through I was told that I had to order my sandwich at the food counter, get a ticket and come back to resume my order and pay at the register (thank you for putting the customer needs first over the employees convenience). Once at the food counter the guy with the rock voice ignored me five minutes, although he saw me; too busy cutting his bread. A younger, nicer but clueless guy finally acknowledged me but messed up my order twice. Back to the register where my coffee was sitting for more than five minutes, and it was not decaf although I said it twice, but the female cashier (consistently horrible throughout many visits) insisted that I didn't. What is wrong with this place??! Not coming back.

7rjj7_tVjL88tgzArCC4HA.text: The food here is amazing!  We go here most weekends and love the food.  I only gave it 3 stars due to service.  It's 50/50 on the service as some times you have to wait a very long time to put your order in and get drinks.  The bus people are great and super attentive, but the wait staff seem to have too many tables or not properly trained.  We do love the food!!!

qH_m9rhe2XJcN3VHR2H4gg.text: So good! The pasta was authentic and delicious. I forgot our servers name (dark hair and glasses) but she was on point. Great experience.

vXVvBXkiracynANisMkYTA.text: Another great happy hour meal. Had the sausage and pepper pizza and it was great!!! Will be back for sure.....great bar staff....

Gs2Ja_w86BAXhqcqwHXXdA.text: We ordered a margarita pizza and ravioli with Alfredo sauce! It was delicious and the dim lights were very romantic! Service was great

GsnU8viF2RZLJVrQoBXv7g.text: Good food friendly service. Happy hour and reverse happy hour. The alfredo is goood! Thow some chicken on that bad boy to get some protein.  carlos and Sabrina make a great team. They'll take care of U behind the bar. Carlos!! Thanks for the water brother. I feel like I got hit by a bus. Probably would have felt worst hadn't U made me drink two glasses of water.

udRLKP6cYsvLaa9LT0UOiQ.text: I have been 2x to this restaurant to.purchase pastries and cookies. They tasted very good. Today at around 3:30 however the service was really bad. The waitress/counter help was not friendly,  kept herself busy with 1 cappucino and a sandwhich order which must have come from the kitchen. Not even a:  I will be right with you to acknowledge a customer! I  had to wait a good 10 min before she even asked me what I wanted and at the time I was the only one standing at the counter. One man came in and walked to the Deli area. There were 2 waitresses in the deli section, one could have come over and helped. Bad customer service! A man with a baseball cap was walking around and went behind the deli counter,  and if that man was a manager,  no wonder the service was bad.

BuhR9kq2yqUupD0Y1pevWw.text: We went for brunch from a friend's recommendation for a amazing experience with a singer. Mark Antonelli didn't disappoint!! My best friend was visiting from Germany and this made her trip.  We ordered eggs Benedict and when I ordered I told the waiter that I love eggs Benedict but I need the eggs poached soft and runny. (Eggs Benny are my favorite) They came and the sauce sad cold, the yolk was almost the consistency of a hard boiled egg.   We will try brunch again because the entertainment was so good ...we will dry something Italian next time I think.

7vP8rBjuxjHBJx45nXVQtw.text: While out and about early on a Sunday looking for a bite to eat we saw their tiny lit up sign in the window that read "OPEN".  I looked at the hubs and we thought...why not!  They offer a full menu on Sundays along with a brunch menu.   We decided on a full meal rather than brunch.  I split the small chopped salad that tasted great!  It was full of fresh cut meats and cheese along with some red onion and garbanzo beans.  All tossed in their great tasting caesar dressing.  I had the rigatoni bolognese.  The serving was HUGE and was incredible.  We were served some bread that tasted fresh!  Service was spectacular!  Our water glasses were filled multiple times.  I look forward to stopping my their deli in the near future or even planning a night out with my husband.  This place has a great warm ambiance.  I noticed they have a nice looking bar too!

Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh baked bread! Yummy!!

mkjE-3KRhkoHgSoz3L96_A.text: This review is for the deli only.  I wanted to make something different for family that was staying with us.  My neighbor recommends this place highly so I gave it a try.  I bought some boxes of frozen stuffed shells made in house and a container of their house made marinara sauce.  The result when I baked the shells was very good.  I took a look at the other frozen pastas they have, and while the price seems higher than supermarkets. I think the quality is higher.  Service was just OK.  Even though it was an hour before closing and no one else was in the store, I had to wait to ask a question until the two young guys on duty finished the conversation they were having.  After looking at me, one of them turned back to his co-worker and continued the conversation.  I was going to give the deli 4 stars, but I deducted one for the lackadaiscal service.

HMDtAsxN-LKqRSsYWuEilw.text: Best place in town. Fresh. Great service. Gluten free options. Great atmosphere. Kids menu options. Completely delicious and never disappointed when we go

ggXfrc8rS4EykcUjyDl_lg.text: There were six of us. We had a great time, great food and very good service. This was my first visit to the restaurant, I go to the deli side on a weekly basis. We started off with cold antipasto platter, that would have made most people say omg! It had various salami, cheese, prosciutto, mortadella, artichoke hearts and more...seemed endless. I chose the Pesci Misto, all grilled to perfection seafood with a side of linguine, excellent. Others had Rigatoni Bolognese, pork belly which had a rich flavor, almost Moroccan and delicious. A whole Braszini fish, served table-side and finally a grilled octopus. I'm told Thursday night is entertainment night and the music was very good. This is a great place, we'll be back

OkiUg7WU1jJ7xlX5asQPYA.text: We visited Siena in the past on two occasions and thought it would be a great location to celebrate a birthday - made a reservation in advance just in case since there are 7 of us all-together.  The table was waiting for us on arrival so that was great to not have to wait.   While waiting for everyone to arrive, we decided to order a bottle of wine and some appetizers.  Did not realize that all the advertisements for Happy Hour only apply to the Bar area - not to the main dining room.  Either way, we ordered the charcuterie board and some fried calamari and a bottle of wine. The bread service came with a small amount of sliced bread and a large amount of 'lavosh' and a small ramekin of olive tapenade.  Not enough bread, especially with the meat and cheese platter we ordered.  Had to ask for more as well as some oil and vinegar - this would normally be brought out with the meat platter automatically.  Not the case.  Once the rest of our party arrived, we proceeded to order some salads and main courses.  The burratta appetizer/salad had a good size portion with a few small sliced heirloom tomatoes and olives.  The other salads were nothing to write home about - the Caesar had a large amount of croutons and very little dressing as well as Ruchetta which was a very small portion (although we did order the small) and again, little dressing.  Our dinners came out just as we took our last bites of salad.    One guest had the Linguine Vongole - this was the absolute worst "linguine and clams" I have ever experienced.  There was no seasoning/herbs present in the broth and all of the clams that were on top for garnish, had NO clams inside!  No amount of salt and pepper could save this dish.  The Cavatelli con Salsiccia looked extremely dry with very little tomato sauce.  We tried rescuing it with some leftover sauce from the calamari.  It actually looked as if it had been sitting under a heat lamp waiting for the rest of the dishes. The other dishes (Rigatoni, Gnocci, Penne Vodka, Ravioli, Lasagna) were all just OK.  The server did come back and ask how everything was so I can say the service was good; however it was not worth sending the dishes back as we were not confident in anything being better.  Being that it was a birthday, I had asked if they could bring out a cannoli with a candle - no problem receiving this however it was the worst cannoli we have ever had.  We could not determine what was in the filling (there was a distinct alcohol taste that we could not figure out).  We asked the server what the filling was made with and were told "ricotta and cream".  NO WAY!  My guess, amaretto of some sort.  Overall, what we thought was going to be a great family dinner turned out to be just a sub-par dinner with good company. I can say for sure that we will NOT return.  Clue to a bad dinner:  when you walk out from a $300 meal and need to hit the closest In-and-Out drive thru!!!

HBjwBvgwQKStQNKw5bXitg.text: I`ve been there once and I don`t plan on ever coming back. We had bruschetta, cannelloni from the lunch menu and pepperoni pizza. The bruschetta was ok, but the cannelloni and the pizza were very bad. I know Italian food and it is not this. I am feeling sick whole day after eating there. I am giving 2 stars because the bruschetta was edible and the wine we had was also nice  (Marlborough sauvignon blanc)

fT8IyCEojaB-0AgD1JR3DQ.text: Ok we were craving Italian food and wanted some hearty dishes! We decided to try Siena out! The moment we walked in the hostess was on her iPhone. I totally get that places get boring but she was not wanting to give the time of day! The place was packed and the first thing I noticed was the decor.. It was very....blah.  The deli was amazing, our waitress was great and the food was so-so. I believe in second chances so I'm willing to go back and hope to be won over :)

GDsnsaivZ-RlaVUCCj5Rtw.text: Ive tried to like this place, really! Ive put in a solid effort but time after time I'm just so disappointed.   1st time- I sat at the bar for lunch. After waiting almost 15 minutes for the bartender to show up, I ordered a glass of Cab and the Carpaccio. The carpaccio came out 20 minutes later, and it was room temperature. Now after working in Italian restaurants for most of my life I know carpaccio is supposed to be cold, due to being raw meat. When i confronted the bartender about this all she said was "that's how its served here" I ordered another glass of wine and didn't touch my meal. When i got the bill i noticed i was charged for two glasses of Merlot. at $16 each & she didn't take the carpaccio off my bill even though it was untouched and I voiced my concern about it.  When I asked her why the Merlot she said "Oh well that's what i poured you, and you drank it" I laughed paid the bill and vowed to never return.  2nd time- Firefly was too busy and my friends all talked me into giving this place another try so I did. It was a disaster. Bartender obviously had friends at the bar so we were ignored the majority of the time, and when we got our bill their were drinks on their that were obviously not ours... but couldn't help but notice the bartenders friends were drinking what was on our bill. Nice dude.. real nice.  3rd time- Came in here last night for the live music. And once again... 100% pure disappointment. We were seating in the lounge area and it was absolutely impossible to get service. The little Russian server was not only rude but we kept having to go up to the bartender for drinks because she was no where to be found.  All i have left to say now is... 3 STRIKES YOUR OUT.

UEDpd6VudqcYbCd1wvrkPg.text: I really enjoyed this place. I also used the Yelp deal buy $10 for $20.   The restaurant has real charm with outdoor tables and a live band.  The ambiance inside is cozy.   Service was top notch! Our server was very patient as we mulled over the specials and menu. We enjoyed the Calamari w/ a great marinara! The sauce is so good, you want to drink it!  We ordered a Cannelloni special and Cavatelli Con Salsiccia - Spicy sausage pasta dish. The pasta was homemade and al dente. Sausage tasted like a meatball. It was really tasty. We also ordered the Italian Black Forest cake for dessert, went great w/coffee.   We tipped the band and used our yelp deal to conclude a wonderful evening.  It's a great place to sit and enjoy dinner. I look forward to coming back every weekend!

hSr2O6XZGq6YR0lAolQs7A.text: Well after my second visit I have decide this is my new favorite dining establishment food was awesome and affordable live entertainment on Weds evening is welcoming and very well done.. Not over done... And the wait staff I'm sure was hand selected by the owner This is a must try Happy Hour is every hour as I was told and there wines are perfect and 50% off most of the dinner hours I enjoy the Santa Christine and sure you will as well

2YduKptjtlQNyfwcRIzZPw.text: Went for a birthday party and had a good time. The staff was attentive and courteous. They handled our small (roughly 10-12) party well.

yLkwKNlynpix-gZ5HH64oQ.text: As I entered into this fabulous Italian restaurant.  I was greeted with warmth and a great big welcome. Let's put it this way great Italian style.  Gina Linzi the restaurants general manager was so kind to take us on a tour of the restaurant and Authentic Italian deli that has every Italian delicacy that you can imagine. From the varieties of formaggio (cheese) Olives from different regions of Italy oh not to mention the Italian gelato and pastries. I can go on and on. You must see for yourself. Gina then proceeded to sit us at the bar area for Happy hour and let me tell you this is not just a happy hr. It was a feast!! The best Italian feast. Gian Carlo the owner was so gracious to proudly serve us 2 great pasta dishes that were out of this world. Along with the fried calamari which was so tender. The lamb chops were sensational every bite was heaven. The variety of cheeses along with figs and fig jam. They do great meat and cheese boards. Great musical entertainment after 830 in bar area. Get there at around seven to enjoy the great experience. Gian Carlo and Gina are great hosts and you will never experience this gastronomic adventure if you Dont get there and try it for yourself. My hats off to Siena Authentic Trattorria!!! Miraviglioso per tutti!!  Marianne Foti Universal Realty

GuzYgXvs7IrcvpgjQDdWNA.text: This is a nice all around Italian deli/restaurant.    We had sandwiches at the deli and it was good.   A bit pricy but worth the extra cost.    I will be going back soon!

lqLQbmvJVPrDcEMrHhfSPQ.text: We ordered 25 cheese and meat trays from this place.  They accommodated our short time frame and the trays looked superb!  I will defiantly be using them in the future for all party platters.

photos.caption: Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat and Cheese Trays

8S2juOjG--hd1yd52ncznQ.text: Great Italian restaurant. Wonderful food! I would have rated this a 5 star but my waitress brought me the wrong order. Even tho the dish was excellent i would have loved to try what I ordered. Its very elegant inside and the wine is delish! Seating is great.

bnM1kIc2x2b6O3DaFClNaw.text: This is one of the best Italian places in Vegas. The food was great, and a great atmosphere to go along with it. It's a little on the fancy side but not too fancy. I'd say a step up from Olive Garden, but not so fancy that your paying extra for a side of meat balls, and another side of broccoli. All in all it is a great place, and food was delicious.

OZhnAqgI66Ghym3wzRd-KQ.text: This is the best italian place I have been to in Vegas. And I don't say this lightly, my wife and I fancy ourselves as Italian food connoisseurs. We have been to several restaurants in the area and this one is the tops. The food is fantastic and so is the service. My wife and I both had the lasagna, because our first time at a new Italian restaurant we always go for the staple. It was perfect, the taste was amazing. I cannot wait to try the other fantastic dishes on the menu. It was my wife's birthday so they gave us a complimentary slice of red velvet cake, which was freaking great. Pasquale was our server and he was fantastic, knowledgeable, and we will definitely ask for him when we return. This was our first of undoubtedly many trips to Siena.

Z9ElOPcQZMqgiWfDlgcJ2Q.text: Giving three stars because the food was good as usual and normally the service is good. This is the first time the service was very bad. It took a long time to have our order taken and even though a glass of wine was ordered during the initial drink request she didn't bring it out until the food came out and it had to be asked for twice.   My tea glass sit empty, we were only checked on once and we were not asked if we wanted desert or coffee. We were very surprised at the service this time as it is usually perfect.

zNWB8Pl457NSR5toPwB7tQ.text: Among the many things I love about this restaurant is the fact that you never know what the entertainment will be, however, you can rely on the fact that there will be some kind of live entertainment. I've seen big bands, solo artists, folk singers, jazz, you name it. The staff is absolutely, positively like the cast of "Cheers" except they are serving gourmet food and concocting delicious martini's and Manhattan's. Todd, the guy who tends bar is funny, very spirited, but above all makes fantastic cocktails. And, seriously...could the staff be anymore good looking?! John Carlo, the owner, he must be there nightly because every time I've been in he's there, but not in a "boss" checking up on his staff kind of way, but being a part of what is going on. The food is delicious and as I've been to many parts of Italy, I find this place to be extremely authentic..the food is beautiful and they have a deli to boot!! If you are looking for ambiance, gourmet meals, fancy cocktails and entertainment, but don't feel like dressing to the nines, come here and enjoy a night of pure Italian bliss!

photos.caption: Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stagioni pizza, Riesling and Todd, bartender extraordinaire!

V8b6h5isAEij7guHNZOUfQ.text: I really like their food. Beautiful restrooms. Our waitress Gloria was great. We will be back!

gQ6_yoWTtDMrF0NbwcAkjw.text: Great atmosphere and exceptional server (Gail) earned the stars. We didn't care for the food and for the quality we thought it was very expensive. Party of four, no appetizers, no drinks - $100.  We've paid much more at other places and raved about the cuisine.  Siena was mediocre at best. We were there around 5:30 on a Wednesday evening so we didn't get to experience the live music. That probably would have earned them another star. Doubtful we'll return. Too many other wonderful restaurants in Summerlin that offer much more for much less.

Qd17MwsoWiSK7XpvAD1T2w.text: Literally was on the table five minutes after ordering. Seems positive except the food taste about as good as 5 minute food can taste. Simple lemonade taste like flavored water which ranked about the same as for blandness of food.  Should have gone to Buca.

uxgvnrdsBECWTvTtVSVD9g.text: We happened onto this restaurant tonight and we have found our Italian restaurant here in Las Vegas. Great atmosphere, amazing food, and excellent service. We will be going back regularly.

PJmmvPu0d0QR5533ZOezlQ.text: Wonderful outdoor seating in beautiful Summerlin!! SUPER GOOD!!!  We used a Yelp Coupon, which we were told is for the restaurant side only, but they would let us use in the deli.  Dinner consisted of 2 Italian Sandwiches (Under $7?!?!?!?!?!?!), juices and a shared slice of cake. (We also had an over priced, not too good piece of lasagna - $10?!?!. But I am not going to hold that against the place)  The women behind the counter were very helpful and friendly. The cakes... OMG, the cakes!!! We had the Mocha, Chocolate Coffee Cake.  Siena is prime to become out new stop for sandwiches and meats. They have an interesting wine selection and a comfortable set up... TRY IT!!

c9y5YHdx1zbmGMw9JOMhkw.text: We first came here as we read about the highly-rated Deli in the LVRJ, which by the way, is fantastic and offers a plethora of goods directly from Italy. They have it all; a fresh deli case filled with pancetta, mortadella, homemade Italian sausage, olive bar and cheeses to a freezer filled with home-made pasta and a hot entree bar. They offer dry goods that range from jars and cans of imported tomatoes, sauce, bruschetta, peppers and outstanding dry pasta. And they have home-made gelato in your typical Italian flavors... highlighted by the spumoni and pistachio! And don't forget about the bread case... from chibiatta to round, yummy loaves of goodness crispy on the outside and soft inside! A little imported olive oil and you're done!   You can eat in the casual deli... or  the restaurant which is comfortable and unassuming. We came back for the restaurant and were not disappointed. Everything our party ordered was fresh and authentic.  We stared with a different and delicious Ruchetta salad containing arugula tossed with figs and dry ricotta, Champagne vinagrette & figs glace. The cream sauce of the fettachini alfredo was outstanding.  Try the Cavatelli con Salsiccia, a rustic dish filled with a spicy sausage ragout, fresh herbs, tomato sauce & Pecorino Cheese. If you're in the mood for Italian... definitely come here!

Q3eVx1D2SIyxAdDYGU-Opg.text: We enjoyed a lovely dinner for two.  Was the best Alfredo Sauce I tasted.  Service was professional.  We will be back

q3Kvlz2k0DLYEkquh9ty-w.text: Disappointed. We have been going to Siena for a few years, but the last 2 times have not been a positive experience. A week ago we went for happy hour, used to love it, but the old guy bartender is horribly slow. We cringe every time we go in and see him working. He got a little busy (not full bar busy) and it was forever for my husband to get a 2nd glass of wine, I tried and my glass was empty for 20 minutes we finally asked for the check...3 times, then had to wait and wait and wait. A couple sat for a half hour waiting to cash out, he held their card, and they had no choice but to wait. I had to ask how long we had to wait before we walked out with out paying, it was that bad.  Tonight we went in for dessert and ordered a full tiramisu. It was made with whipped cream. Not just whipped cream on top, all throughout the cake. Being Italian you know better. It was greasy whipped cream, meaning not fresh homemade whip cream, but the stuff you pipe out of a bag made with hydrogenated oil. Come on Siena Step it up, I know you are better than this (hence the 2 star rating). I've experienced it. Do not cut corners, it just cuts your customers. We won't be back for a long long time.

IPVhqF0pkedGuFKbwiFaYg.text: So me and the wife went there on a Friday night for dinner. It was kind of late and the place was empty except for the bar area.  So we got seated the waiter came over took out drink order, got the drinks asked about the soups and was told that the soup we ordered had no meat on it got the soup and what do you know it had pork in it asked the waiter and his response was I didn't know there was any meat in there. Ok I know it happens once in a while so he took back the soup and got a different soup which had no meat in it.  On the main entree since it was late we decided to share the steak dish. The waiter takes our order not asking how we want it cooked. Steak comes out looks good and that was about it. Had the first piece which was chewy as gum. Then  took the knife to the second piece and the rest of it was so rare that it was purple inside. Called the waiter over and notified him about this tells us ok I will put it back on the grill to cook a little more. Wow! What put it back on the grill! After we touched it. We were both appalled at this so we asked for the manager.  Manager comes over tell her what the waiter was going to do and just side tracked and said oh we can get you a new dish. No I'm sorry, no the waiter said that by mistake! Nothing. Don't want to know what goes on in that kitchen!  By that time I was already turned off told her just give us the damn check!  One star in for the soup and salad we had otherwise no stars for this place!  This place is CUT!

nJI838BorxhZzU4ppV5mOg.text: I love to hear the Goodfellas on Thursday night but putting up with the rude bartender try's on my nerves. It's not only his rudeness but he short changes you and when you try to point it out to him he walk away. It not the first the this has happened but many many times. Also the prices during happy hour aren't very happy.

tZ7k8yiMVIy_ChcvCWYE_g.text: Do NOT believe the hype. I have been here four times.  Each time something worse happens. I'm not sure who is to blame for the poorly behaved and badly trained wait staff, but one thing I can say for sure, after the fourth visit, is that the poor service and way below average food quality are definitely consistent!  My last (and final) visit to this restaurant included:  frozen, reheated crab cakes, that were disgusting; an 11.00 spinach salad that consisted exactly of spinach, six raw walnuts, and 5 pieces of artichoke hearts;  and then there was the entree.  The entree was our final knife in the gut and pocket book.  We ordered the lobster and steak special.  We specifically asked the waiter for a filet cut of steak.  He served us a small piece of grisly meat that my giant, sharp, steak knife, literally could not cut through!  When we told him it was not filet, he was condescending and rude and acted like we didn't know what we were talking about!  Grrr!    We were highly insulted that they would pass this horrible quality and poorly made menu items off as authentic Italian cuisine. If that is authentic Italian cuisine, no one would ever lay claim to it!  The manager half heartedly apologized, although she seemed more worried about upsetting the condescending waiter than she was concerned about our horrible experience, and she removed the uneaten special from our bill.    I have not ever wrote a bad restaurant review, however, they should not be able to get away with this in a city filled with amazing restaurant options.   I hope that they can address their issues and be an asset to our community in the future.

iMuO9S0mo1gTvFvUsejiPQ.text: The meal was perfect. Start off they bring you some bread and home made pasta chips. To top it off they add this fantastic crushed olive spread. So good had to buy some chips and spread to take home to my daughter. The Chicken Marsala was tender and perfect.  Best yet, the flourless Chocolate cake, SOOOO Good. Definitely a place I will come to eat when back in town. The service as well gets five star.

PSg8zmAhFohOJArLEp1mXA.text: I've been here so many times for reverse happy hour and I always have a great experience. The food is so delicious. My favorites are the shrimp scampi and the meatballs. I enjoy the live music, I think it's a great addition to the experience.

YykkcwPFb-LBzOi6k49Rwg.text: Went there again today, ordered an Sicilian sandwich and it was great! I was excited when they told me they had rainbow cookies again (since they are my fav) and now I'm left disappointed again, the cookies are dry and hard not the way cookies should be! I spent $7 on a bag of cookies that I just threw in the trash!

lLU3yeqfVW0xPlUFbRrsiw.text: Amazing fettucine, melt in your mouth noodles, creamy Alfredo sauce, excellent service, definitely recommend a visit, you won't be disappointed! Plus they are current with the times- i.e. wifi, yelp deals, opentable, etc.  5 Stars isn't enough to tell you how impressed I was with this restaurant.... I LOVED it. GO THERE NOW!

cvuUnrfTHiPDn9i3S9SXzw.text: Absolutely love this restaurant! Live music is great and the food is yummy (=

YQbydW5b4WJggv3dEPi9NA.text: Authentic Italian style sandwiches and deli. I could eat here every day. Only complaint is that it is a bit pricy. My place in Los Angeles was much less expensive. But if you want a great Italian sandwich in Vegas this is the only place to eat.

Cl8E0DF4LkN4obUOjmnOlw.text: I come here every tue night for karaoke drinks n dinner with a group of 5-10 people regularly. I happen to eat raw...so I asked for sliced tomatoes as a app. I was originally charged $13 for a caprese salad...5 slices of un-ripe tomatoes slices. I threw a fit..so they changed it to $7. The server didnt know how to make a long island and only seemed to care about racking up the bill and her tip. They lost my business!  John Carlo...that is cheep low business practice to over-charge. Keep return customers happy..or they don't return. An entire veal canoli cost $8....so did 5 tomatoe slices. Reduliculous!

A8kWQVgT2Yk94ge0jENKHw.text: As far as the deli is concerned, this place appears to have it all, pasta, cheeses, deli meats, sauces, bread, etc. We ventured here for lunch on a weekday and surprisingly it was completely empty. The 4 of us ordered from the lunch specials and received the complimentary bread and olive tapenade. The server was very friendly and super attentive, yet again we were the only ones there for the first 30 minutes. I ordered the ciabatta steak sandwich lunch special which came with fried fingerling potatoes. The potatoes were quite tasty, a mix of purple, red, golden and sweet potatoes. The sandwich however, left a lot to be desired. The description was a thinly sliced steak sandwich. What I received was a skirt steak with absolutely no flavor and way too thick to just take a bite of. My first bite extracted the whole slice of meat from the bread so I resorted to cutting the steak piece by piece and eating the bread separately. I wouldn't have minded having to do this if the sandwich had more flavor but it was just blah and boring. The sandwich itself was very large and I was only able to finish one half of it. My friends had the cold cut sandwich, the vegetarian sandwich and the pear salad. They all enjoyed their dishes without complaint. For dessert we all ordered the gelato. It redeemed the meal for me! I had the spumoni flavor and it was creamy and fresh. If I ever return I would definitely order one of the pasta dishes next time.

WvGct5kaufy-u8b2xAZNWQ.text: Have enjoyed the food, Entertainment , and Friendly faces for years . Now I live closer I hope to be there for every Salsa Saturday. Thanks for having such a warm wonderful place for a warm drink .

uXnqNgszKJOZMX5szsFDIg.text: Being accustomed to all of the great Italian restaurant choices in the Chicago area I was very pleased with our dinner at Siena.  Nice atmosphere, good food and reasonably priced.  I would definitely come again when back in town.

lbp2KedG0EJvdvdJQnq3YQ.text: Bar on one side, a deli on the other, with a great restaurant in between. Incredible staff. Unbelievable dining.

-AYqRIvdgA_QOkI4jmckpw.text: So first off, the only side of this 2 sided joint I am reviewing is the deli side, I have not dined in the main dining room as of yet.  This is a great place that my wife and I go to for fresh deli sandwiches.   The service is always quick and pleasant every time I venture in here. All of the meats and cheeses are fresh making the selection of sandwich variations endless and very good.  The pasta salad and the cucumber are our favorite sides and a great refreshing add on during the hot summer months.  Hopefully I will be able to return and sample the dining side to update this review fully.

L-mr_emLk6pcRJHi7HCgzA.text: This place is awesome.   We moved here from the NY and NJ and coming here was like being home.   Delicious food, very nice owners and employees. We were so pleased and look forward to many shopping trips here.

-j29D0iuYR5_cRjH5PU5bw.text: I visited Siena on Tuesday with a bridal shower party of 16. The private room we were given was beautiful, but that was the end to the perks of the restaurant. The bread service had pita chips and bread with an olive tapenade. It comes in ramekins that hold 1 tablespoon of tapenade, and given to share among 4 people. So, we were pretty much all able to have 1 slice of bread with tapenade on it. Wonderful!  We split an aragula salad which was actually very tasty. It had figs and some tasty cheese, but a tad too much dressing. That was the best part of my meal. My mother-in-law next to me ordered the penne (I think) and the pasta looked homemade. I suppose that's the one up-side of this place. Several of the pasta dishes looked like it was homemade pasta, but me, wanting to be healthy, opted for something low-carb. When it came to ordering, I opted for the salmon with a side of asparagus (4 stalks). My friend next to me ordered the same thing, and we were both incredibly disappointed. The salmon looks like it was butterflied in half so that we each got about 3 oz. of salmon that was incredibly thin. Mine was over-cooked to say the least, but hers was burned. The whole outside was black and charred... Unfortunately, the salmon which came highly praised by the waiter (whom I only saw one time when he took my order), was so small that I ended up starving and eating a bunch of bread just to fill up. So much for low carb.   Since our party was so large, there was an automatic 20% gratuity attached onto it, which would be fine, if I ever got a refill on my water glass. I was so thirsty, I almost drank my friend's water. Sorry, but I will never be back. I think most of the people at my table shared this sentiment. My total for half a of a salad, very poorly cooked, thin salmon, and 4 stalks of asparagus with 20% gratuity was $36. I think I could have purchased a weeks worth of wild salmon and cooked it better myself.

W5qusBb4CI70JjzYrOiNOA.text: I've finally had the chance to experience this eating establishment.  It's one of those places that I've driven by many times. Despite intending to go in. Finally, my beautiful one and decided to celebrate our anniversary there. First staff is very inviting and attentive. Atmosphere and Ambience was very delightful. We also like the fact that even though there was music playing overhead and people were talking the noise level was very good where we could at least have an intimate conversation without screaming at each other. The menu was very extensive there was a very good variety of choices of authentic Italian food. We started off ordering off of the happy hour menu with crab cakes and shrimp scampi. The food came out an adequate time. The crab cakes were moist very good texture fried perfectly with a small side salad sprinkle lightly with Thousand Island dressing. Shrimp scampi was very tasty season very well and the shrimp melted in my mouth. 4 on tree get the angel hair shrimp and also the veal Milanese. Both entrees were prepared just right presentation was over average. After dinner we had dessert and coffee those two were very pleasing and satisfying nice place to take a special person or the date that you just want to make a nice impression.

UwvhV0Mmmu1h-Bi5vyU4kA.text: We truly enjoyed our meals and Peroni beers.  The deli and restaurant was authentic.  The staff went above and beyond.  A great value!

VykS98AxKydSfdrkuDXLiA.text: Staying at La Quinta Inn next door with our 3 fur babies. They were gracious enough to let us dine on their patio with the pups in their doggie stroller. The bread was some of the best, baked in house. I had the arugula and fig salad, the dressing was sweet and tart and delicious. The branzino with lemon caper sauce was prepared perfectly along with the roasted medley and sauted spinach with slices of garlic.my husband has pasta with homemade sausage. We could not have been happier with our meal. This place is a favorite with the locals..don't miss it! The service from Dima was impeccable.

Qaz4alCX0e2t7np_f58Yyg.text: Good food and good locale; inconsistent and adequate service. Lady behind counter can't multitask, you have to wait between each request, I.e. Ordering cookies, only one at a time...needs improvement, but I will continue to go. Revisited Siena to give it a second chance.  Going to recant my previous statement that I will continue to go.  Deli has no supervision and if you ask for any special request, the staff cannot process it. Asked for a cappuccino in a to-go cup, couldn't comprehend what I wanted. Received a small ceramic mug.  Sausage, pepper and egg sandwich changed. Used to be served mixed together with real eggs, now tastes like egg beaters and everything is separated, layered on top of each other. plus peppers and onions were cold and raw. Too bad they let the place go, glad we still have Roma Deli...

PSfpYrFWOiYuYdCiIVVn7A.text: Bad costumer service the attention is terrible between in the restaurant nobody came to take care of me I decided to go

FVyQAfwsB1XvRmqUwEsmGw.text: This place is really good! Definitely one of the better Italian restaurants in town, and certainly one of the most unique. I've been here twice - and I had two totally different experiences, but this place (for the most part) is very well-run, so I'll give it four stars.  The first time I came here was a few Thursdays ago. There was a live band of a bunch of older guys and they were horrifically loud. I actually left the bar and went into the dining room to get away from the awful off-key singing and loud playing. My pasta that night was also a little undercooked, which I was definitely upset about... but the owner came out, apologized and gave a completely new pasta within minutes.   Once I got my food fixed, I then realized Sienna has some of the best Italian food Vegas has to offer!! (FYI, they also have a deli... I took some cold cuts home with me... YUM!)  If you want my advice, come here on a Wednesday... I came last week and there is a guy singing to karaoke tracks but he is actually a very nice man and a very good singer, and he's not too loud unlike that Thursday night band. Also, it's not too crowded on a Wednesday. That's a plus. He asked me if I had a request which I thought was incredibly nice of him. I'm so sorry I can't remember his name, but I assure you he's a very nice kid.  So yeah, definitely come here on a Wednesday. They also have live music on Friday and Saturday nights, but I haven't tried out the other acts yet. I might give it a shot because their food, I assure you, is excellent.

PVGMQ4Adr0Y-HOuKYndryA.text: This place looks beautiful but the food was disgusting. We ordered the crab cakes which were deep fried, greasy and tasted like tuna fish. The minestrone soup was extremely salty and the raviolis were just bland. My 6 year old ate only a few slices of the cheese pizza and this was the first time that he ever did not finish it and he eats a lot of pizza. After sending back the soup and crab cakes, you would think the manager would come over to talk but she did not even though the place was empty. I am sitting on my car writing this with my wife and we both have sudden stomach issues. I would never come back here and suggest that you do not either.

DTwATqZ3NWop-v2_h7b5Xg.text: Yum, the food here is SO delicious. It is consistent every single time. It's divided into three sections, the deli, the dining room, and the lounge where the bar is located. They have live music and AMAZING happy hour specials (drinks from 3-7 and again from 9-close...and ALL DAY on Sunday's!) the building itself is clean and beautifully decorated. Service is knowledgeable, kind and welcoming. Or stop in for a quick and delicious lunch (or dessert and latte) in the deli, where you can also pick up an amazing bottle of wine. If you haven't tried Siena yet, you must!!

-mRYhpW-q-gm9MgLhXQzDA.text: We came here for dinner with friends and enjoyed a nice relaxing meal.  We started with some antipasto, the Buongustaio and the plate was plenty for the 5 of us.  Then we ordered our entrees,  We had the Cacciatore pizza with sausage, special pasta of the day, little pillows, salmon alla griglia (salmon with spinach), Zuppa Reale, a delish spicy Italian bouillabaisse with seafood and a tasty broth, and I ordered the Tagliolini ai fruitti di mare.  Tasty bread and bread chips were served before our dinner arrived.  My frutti di mare was flavorful and plentiful.
