-E-nrLYrT1_PZuXd-q9vhg.text: I don't understand how this place doesn't have 5 stars. It is easily one of the best Italian restaurants in Las Vegas. EASILY! So authentic, 5 star atmosphere with 3 star prices.

xxIt7hNUsL1DeZUFgMqUxA.text: This review is for the deli and market. OMG! Can't believe this has been under my nose for so long. This is...by far...the best Italian deli/market in town! Excellent selection of meats and cheeses which were sliced and packaged with great care and patience. Awesome cookies and market has everything you could think of to prepare a great meal! Haven't tried their restaurant but I assure you-this has now become my go to market!!!

gqEoOOleqiSxvx_C6x8sUw.text: This is one of my very favorite restaurants/deli. I always bring my guests to this place and we are never disappointed. Its very elegant, yet laid back and she. I bring my kids, I don't have the whole restaurant staring at us. The service has been great every single time I have visited. They also have a deli next door where they serve fresh food and groceries. The bathroom is phenomenal with a homemade scrub for your hands that makes your skin feel so refreshed. The location is clean and easy to find. I will be back!

8XLQEaqCf9FJy-Rq5_pl5w.text: I was recently given this restaurant by a local in the Summerlin area as a must try for Italian. They have an Italian market and bakery attached to the restaurant and make their own bread and deserts.  I opted for an early dinner (Happy Hour time frame). I sat in the bar area and ordered a full meal. The bar was very large and there were about 16 people in the bar area enjoying their happy hour cocktails (40% off) and appetizer specials.  The Spicy fried calamari was a bit over fried. To me, it seemed as if it was frozen and fried out of the box. There was NO spice at all and the marinara that was served with it also had no spice. This dish could definitely use some work.   The Italian Antipasto was exactly as expected. Fresh cured meats, cheese's, etc.   The chicken marsala was very light and well prepared. The mashed potatoes were not too desirable but decent. I think a nice risotto would be a better accompaniment than the "american" mashed potato.   The lasagna, my specialty being Italian, was a good portion but a dish full of sheets of pasta. Nice pasta but way too many layers with almost nothing in-between the sheets of pasta. I touch of fresh sliced basil across the top would have given a fresh pop to the dish.   I will come back and try another dish or two but I will not do the lasagna or calamari again.   Cannoli made fresh. Comes with chocolate chips. Didn't seem to have an option. I prefer options like almonds instead of chocolate chips. But, that is just me. The shell was done to perfection and the ricotta chocolate chip center was creamed just right. You must like chocolate and appreciate a perfectly cooked cannoli shell for this desert. It is a must try if you are a cannoli person.  The service was wonderful. Kind, polite, attentive and very helpful.  If you are looking for a good happy hour with a crowd in their early 60's on up this is your spot. Everyone at the bar seemed to be locals and enjoying each others company.

photos.caption: Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chocolate chip cannoli

BHiBAbmUHghk_W5W0D-y-Q.text: This was my 1st time eating here I will come back. I had their meatballs and garlic bread awesome

80Fj7XUsQt6RSDWu7Rg7HQ.text: Initially, the service and ambiance were both outstanding. Our waiter, Marco, was friendly and engaging, at first, which is always appreciated and makes it all that more of a memorable experience, only until we had placed our orders with him. I hadn't mind Marco giving advice on what to pair our meal with or what appetizer he would recommend, although he seemed to make the decision for us rather than ask us. It soon became apparent that Marco didn't want to serve us, he would ignore my table even though we were in plane view of him being very attentive towards his other tables. Flagging him down became problematic as the bussers/runners were more attentive and cordial than our own waiter. He casually walked by asking if we were enjoying ourselves, but didn't stay to hear our response. We ordered a seafood pasta, which was fantastic, and a seafood risotto, which had great flavor but came with over baked and dried cod. We had noted it to Marco, not to have the kitchen remake the whole dish, but perhaps remake the cod or just let them know for the next customer they make the dish for, who then told us that we were wrong and that the fish was prepared al dente. Then he had the audacity to tell us to taste it again to see if it's better?? When we told him no that it wasn't going to change anything he immediately told us he'd get a manager. She had checked up on us and apologized on behalf of Marco, but when we tried to flag him down to get the rest of our meal to go, he kept passing us by to tend to other tables. We ended up getting the attention of two runners who took care of it for us and apologized for our server. Marco still would not come to us, seeming to purposefully ignore us like a child. I ended up asking the hostess if it was possible for us to get the check because our waiter seemed to stop providing us service. She informed a manager and apologized on behalf of Marco. (This being the third time someone has apologized on behalf of him). Marco came back to our table with complimentary cake and a noticeable attitude, almost mocking, as if he hadn't been purposely ignoring us. We wish he was more sincere or could have apologized himself rather than have others do it for him. It really seemed like we were being served by a petty child. We left the cake untouched and paid for our meal because we weren't looking for any free giveaways or for our meal to be compensated. Our waiter had turned our whole experience sour, but everyone else seemed like they genuinely understood what we were going through. Perhaps Marco wasn't in a good mood that night, but unfortunately that left a bad first impression for Sienna Italian on us.

u88pKKLPYdRGb9wCxLqt_A.text: Very clean food super tasty. Loved the chicken. The staff was some of the friendliest I've seen in a while.

DPkUNhVPLLmgdZf_Ks3tqw.text: Every time I come into this deli I always ask myself why?? 20 minutes for a half pound of prosciutto because the lady was too busy chatting to the kitchen staff!! Also one of the servers from the restaurant behind the deli counter while my order was being cut with no hairnet or cap!!! Then she actually leans her head over the cutter to look at my meat!!! I wouldn't mind paying for their overpriced products if at least the staff was attentive and friendly and efficient.

DO2hkjZ2M7BFiMo0QN-qJQ.text: Top Sirloin Peppercorn Amazingness!! Everything is fresh and super clean spot. Great service  We will return  They have entertainment also just ask.

_oP25IvuWXCEN6p43QR3_w.text: The good: the pasta is actually tasty; my ravioli tasted fresh and house-made, as opposed to something out of a frozen package. The filling was also good. The so-so: the sauce tasted like it came out of a can--very basic, uninteresting. The price point is a bit high considering that. The lunch specials do not look particularly good, so I opted for a dish off the regular menu. The awkward: two members of the staff bickered a bit while I was eating. I think that was probably an isolated occurrence though.  Overall, there are some definite positives, and the pasta is a standout. But I wish it came with a better sauce, or a lower price point.

n-8nXS74vTNpm-VSJPg7fw.text: Just went to Siena Italian on Sahara, and the food was very good. Now to the bad part. When we walked in to get seated nobody was around to seat us not a good start. Then when someone went to seat us it was like he was being put out, and then he became our waiter. In all of the restaurants I have gone to I have never been treated the way we were. Waiter was very rude to us, and took forever for us to place our order. Mind you it was not very busy at 3:15pm on a Wednesday. I wish I had gotten his name, but it was too dark in the restaurant. When we tried to ask him a question he just continually kept walking. I don't know if our waiter was having a bad day, but I for one will never put up with terrible service, and rude waiters. Again we loved the food, but not a way we want to spend our day for a pre valentines dinner. We will not be back. I am just VERY disappointed in this restaurant's snooty service.

Vk3bUcgd5UDX4_2dQPG19w.text: Review is for the store/market part of Siena.  I used to come here for their great ricotta. Thought it was Polly-O. They have huge gallons of it you can buy. I just picked up a small deli container. Bring it home - its not Polly-O (wat?!?) flavorless, runny and nowhere as good as the ricotta I got from them at their eastside location. Not sure what's up with that, but from now on I'm getting my (Poly-O) ricotta from the Roma deli on Spring Mtn. Also picked up a, $8 ball of mozzarella. No flavor. What's up with the cheese situation here, Siena. Italian and their cheese are supposed to be top notch, no excuses. At least make your own mozzarella in-house. Come on.    I have ordered their grilled eggplant sammie before (again, from their eastside location) and it was great. Will report back at some point if its still quality on this side of town.   Overall not too happy with my $$$ purchases from the fresh deli side of the house.

g8fAhVqBsC-BN6otcn85OA.text: Another awesome review for Siena.  I've been going there for years, and in those years I have never had a disappointing experience.  The character of the place, first of all, is fantastic.  The deli counter is lively and bustling, the market area, although small, is crammed full of interesting goodies that beg to be taken home and placed in your pantry, and the dining area with the red and white tablecloths all lend the place a homey feel - if your home happens to be Italy or even Little Italy.  The breads up front always tempt me with their fresh, crusty look and the cheese selection is dynamite, outta sight.  Their lasagna is absolutely heavenly, their Sicilian pizza wins over everything else in town that tries to come close, and the garlic knots will make you unkissable for days but you won't even care because they're that tasty.  Their deli salads are all superb, apparently even the calamari salad. (I am not touching that with a ten foot pole though.)   The most amazing, splendiferous thing about Siena?  They are awesome, honest, just-plain-good people.  One day I lost my wallet there and spent hours panicking.  I called Siena and they hadn't seen it until later in the day someone was sweeping by the register and my wallet had been kicked under the cabinet that holds it.  They found my business card inside and called me at work.  My wallet was returned to me, all eight measly dollars, ATM cards, and identification accounted for.  Visit them NOW, they will rock your socks off.

photos.caption: Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DMPApU5a5jlXd6YK-Iy_xA.text: I went to Siena with a party of 12 for Happy Hour.  If you want to be drench with ice cold water by a busboy filling your water glass, not receiving your change when you pay your bill because the waitress assumes it's her tip and not honoring the eclub coupon, than this is the place for you.  The happy hour bar food was average but prices not so happy.  I can't recommend this restaurant at this time.

h8KmTinQttEGpXxiiMTjvQ.text: I am an Asian addict. I rarely eat anything that does not come from that lovely continent. I mean it is the largest and most populated, so odds are they're going to have some winning cuisines--and they do. But, yesterday, I managed to take myself to Siena, an Italian restaurant.  The interior, while not trendsetting, is nice and clean. They are in the middle of a big remodel as they are adding a patio and some other features, like a deli, which I think will be nice as my understanding is they are going for a more cafe feel for that section. Cafes are a welcome addition to my hood.  The service got the job done but without finesse or flair. Honestly, I think he decided we were not a valuable table when we started out by just ordering water. I was a server once, and I know when a table goes for the tap you start thinking they're cheapos, but, it's just not right. I noticed that he told another table the specials, but not us. We clearly weren't "special" material. He didn't refill our water glasses once. Still, the service was not terrible; it just wasn't remarkable.  As for the food, it was good, but not a good value. I was honestly a little excited to see a salad with apples on the menu. I am a sucker for fruit and greens, but when the salad arrived, it had 4 thin slices on the corner of the plate. That is really more of a garnish and perhaps not worthy of a line item mention on a menu. If they upped the apple quotient, I think this could be a really craveable salad, as the cheese, walnuts and vinaigrette were done well. We also ordered the Healthy Choice pasta: organic & whole-wheat angel hair roasted tomatoes, sundried tomatoes, olive oil, garlic, and fresh basil. I loved the bountiful, fresh slices of garlic. If I had made this dish at home, I'd be giving myself a big hug. However, I paid $14.75 for it, and the portion was a little small. I am not ready to dole out hugs for that.   To end on a positive note: The breadbasket and olive tapenade were delicious. The bread came out hot and fresh, and it has become quite a challenge to find a hot breadbasket in this town. Those loafs alone are earning Siena 3 stars, but I probably won't return until the cafe is finished. In the meantime, catch me in Chinatown.

vlZU5Mld9KdOnJSn8YOo2w.text: Incredible!! My wife and I are so glad that Siena has come to the west side! We used to drive to the other end of town to shop at Siena's market and get a slice of pizza or some ravioli, now they're right in our backyard!     We were there this last Friday night for a birthday party and were fortunate enough to sample a number of dishes we hadn't ordered on previous visits. First and foremost on our last visit was the gnocchi with basil pesto. The gnocchi is far lighter than at most restaurants and the basil pesto was perfect. The pizza was also exellent! Thin, crisp crust made with double zero flour and charred to perfection. The antipasto platter is a great starter for any meal. Our meal ended with my favorite dessert, tiramisu and port!     Chef Giancarlo spent a great deal of time with us and made sure we all had a great time and an excellent meal. He even broke into his private stash of Lemoncello and had an after dinner drink with us. There aren't many places where the owner/ chef spend the time with the patrons that Chef Giancarlo does at Siena. If you like great Italian food and an all around cool spot, Siena is it!    BTW, the wine list is great and priced right.

V8CR0Tu9pGJ22azsK_Ixjw.text: Went for a late dinner, the dining room was closed, but there was plenty of room in the bar area. There was live music, that was targeted for a little older crowd. The food was tasty, but not delicious. Comfortable atmosphere and good service.

k6mxyLcY8iSATneTT5fkjQ.text: Beautiful food and great service! Had the surf n turf and husband had the osso buco.  Food was good, service excellent, prices very reasonable,  and the place is beautifully designed and comfortable.  We will definitely go back!  Make a reservation if you go on a weekend.

NwQOoIX22dg9yIrrQXyCHQ.text: SIENA is our go  to Restaurant! THE food is consistently good.  The specials are unique, high quality and great value.  THE staff is always friendly and knowledgeable about the food and specials.  EVERYONE we have brought to the restaurant have enjoyed their meals.  KUDOS to CHEF GIANCARLO and his Staff!

BoDrcLB4YpHQAqLlljuWIA.text: Nice place! Food was very nice and the service was very good. Will go back again and try something else on the menu. I had the whole stripped bass and it was amazing. The best part of this place are the homemade cannoli's made to order. Wow!

vcux_mue3VwU01ZohwTehw.text: We hadn't been back to Siena Trattoria for more than a year because last time we were there we weren't really impressed. Today was our 5 year anniversary and we decided to give it another shot.   First thing I noticed upon entering was that they had undergone a nice remodel! Everything looked fresh and clean with modern cool colors. We chose to sit in the bar area as Happy Hour was going on and we wanted to take advantage of the special pricing. However, it was eerily quiet, as there was no ambient music playing and it was very easy to hear everyone's conversations as the tables are very close together.   We found a table easily and were greeted quickly by Todd, who was very knowledgeable about the menu and happy hour offerings. We ordered some wine (a pinot noir and nero d'avola which were both delicious and about $6 each on the happy hour) and some appetizers right away. We were quickly and efficiently served water, a bread basket (which comes with a very nice olive tapenade for dipping) and our wine. Our food arrived quickly as well. My boyfriend ordered the beef carpaccio and cannelloni. I had the eggplant parmesan. I am a vegetarian and the happy hour menu was slightly lacking in vegetarian options so I also ordered  a pesto penne primavera from the regular menu. Everything was delicious but the eggplant was simply OUTSTANDING. The best I've ever had. it was thinly sliced and lightly battered and topped with mozzarella and just the right amount of marinara. Being a vegetarian, I've had a lot of eggplant but this was simply the best. The BF really enjoyed his dishes as well and my pasta was quite good also. I think they may have overhauled the menu as well during the remodel as it was way better than I remember from last year.   The service was excellent, we were offered more wine, our waters refilled and dishes cleared in a timely manner. Everyone was friendly and knowledgable. Our food and wine were incredibly tasty. I docked one star for lack of ambience (no music at all! Not even for background) and I think they are kind of over priced in general but the happy hour pricing makes up for that. I wish we would have had room for dessert, they looked amazing! But we were so full we just settled for espresso which was delightful!   We will definitely be back! During happy hour of course :)

rTy4ehy_Ej4K2ZLrj-si5w.text: Pretty standard for an Italian place. The food was good but not super amazing. The service was okay too, our waiter was really rushed and would walk away before we were done talking to him. The prices were a little high for what you actually get but not outrageous or anything. Overall the it's has a nice atmosphere and a consistent taste so I'd definitely give it another try.

HmWqmbHLcx6PM9uoWQVLdw.text: We went for lunch a few days ago. Nice and A/C's on a hot day. We stood waiting for attention at the counter for about 5-10 minutes before being acknowledged, but we got our order in, got some drinks paid and sat down to wait for the food, which came pretty quickly. The caesar was great. Our sandwich ( the Siena chicken cutlet) was bland but big. The Cavatelli with Ragout was just as flavorless but considering it was the signature pasta dish according to their posted menu, it was terrible. The Italian dude that served us was cool though and took care of our table. Groovy Italian music videos gave the dining space some ambiance.  Prices have gone up since they posted their menu online.   They seem like nice people and there were some potentially good choices in the deli cases, and we had high hopes after the glowing reviews, especially after getting into the caesar salad, but the experience took a nose-dive with the main dishes. $40 after a tip and a couple sodas for crummy food.  We probably won't make it back to try the pizza. Sorry boys. Overall I'd recommend Tivoli Gardens: It's right down the street, the prices are the same, the food is better and it's an actual restaurant where you're served at a nice linened table.

FctAvE-sZiR2iF30ThipxA.text: This is one of the best italan restaurants in Vegas but its a hole in the wall so not many people know about it. Their gnocchi pesto and penne vodka with sausage it TO DIE FOR.  They import a lot of their products from New York or Italy so everything I have ever had here is amazing.  Anyone I have ever brought here felt the same. Service is always on point, quick to greet and get our food to us within 15-20 minutes. Their garlic and pesto spread for the bread is also amazing and homemade. Try thi place out if you haven't already, you won't regret it.

504ZKt_QzjoagAjU70aA6g.text: Excellent greeting from Carolina. Service overall was fantastic. We had the cheese pizza which was very tasty. Overall, I would return.

Oj2rYLuI-JLvrLOvVyjEOg.text: Still wonderful food! Make sure you go during happy hour as their bottles of wine are half price. We just had lobster ravioli and it was to die for!

kO7pis1UieZ9La6ALCpfqQ.text: The new Siena on West Sahara is decorated nicely but the food is bland and just average AND the service is terrible. The blond, older woman bartender brought us the menu with an icy stare and unfriendly demeanor. And acted as if she'd never seen us before while she asked for our I.D.'s (even though we've been in there 4 times recently) every time we've been in when she was working she always has an attitude. They used to have a nice, younger bartender working but we don't know what happened to her.   The restaurant is new and not very busy. I would think that if they plan on staying in business they'd want that old crank to change her attitude or get out from behind the bar. I've been a bartender for 4 yrs and would never dream of acting like her while I'm working.   We've decided not to go back.

7vKpFPgBIHdK36hqWNz7Yg.text: Food was very good and the prices very reasonable.  Lowered the stars because our server looked like she had just gotten out of bed, her hair was all over the place and she smelled like booze.  We had to ask for drink refills.

B1_Ybw611rl9o2Y3FvSjiw.text: Went there on Easter Sunday. The place was empty and we we were immediately seated. It took the server, Jaime, a good 3-4 minutes to even acknowledge us and then the same amount of time to bring us our soft drinks. The food was good and a great value. I was extremely thirsty and asked if he could leave the H2O pitcher on the table since I did not want to wait for refills. He left the pitcher and within a couple minutes he came and took it saying his manager would not allow this.   The food comes and just prior to making room on the table for the plates he coughs into his hand and then moves my silverware. I asked if he was out of his mind and gave me a blank look. I asked him to wash his hands prior to placing the plates and to secure me new utensils.   This place needs to put the guest needs first rather than removing the water pitcher and teach the staff proper food handling skills.

f1p5V3Udb9Bs9LUpvqKSrg.text: First time there and I really am a fan. Had the lunch special meat cannelloni and it was the best I've ever had. The deli is very well stocked and the Italian cookies are great. I will return!

LnzKPGVQt7KLEoZOOPuKAQ.text: Lobster ravolis here are awesome...  great to buy pasta and sauces, but deserts are not of the same caliber...

_I1c097I7gD5ykej42UIlQ.text: This restaurant is so good! Super authentic food, pastries and deli selections as well as a wide artist of imported foods and wines. I recently moved to NV and I will be making this restaurant a regular stop.

8uIH6kxhZFd_ejPvKZHDxg.text: As I'm reading all these reviews - one thing stands out. We are ALL COMPLAINING ABOUT THE SERVICE. I'm sure a manager or owner reads these (maybe they don't and that's the problem) but do something in regards to training your wait staff! I was so excited to try this place for Mother's Day, my husband surprised me with reservations. As we were seated at the booth in the far back next to the kitchen, the waiter, I didn't catch his name (he was a shorter Italian looking gentleman) came over And took our drink orders. My husband ordered a Coke light ice and I ordered a Coke with lemon. Not that complicated. Somehow our drinks came out with ice from the bottom to the top of the glass, and a lemon. First strike. We then ordered our food which came out in a reasonable amount of time considering it was a holiday. I had lasagna and my husband had the fettuccine Alfredo which was made with fresh pasta and I believe pancetta and it was delicious. We were enjoying our meal, and all of a sudden something on the other side of the wall apparently slipped off and splattered on my shoe. One of the waitresses apologized I believe it was in all of tapenade that spilled. No sign of my waiter at all. We finished our meal and I then asked to see a dessert menu, and I was excited to see they had sfigatella on the menu. The waiter wasn't sure if they had any left, went over to the deli side to check, left dessert menus on our table. I found that strange. They were all out unfortunately, so I ordered a small dish of hazelnut gelato. He came back over with a different flavor of gelato, not what I ordered. And a trio dessert plate which he left on our table. We didn't order it. At this point my husband and I looked at each other and were wondering what the heck was going on, because there was a dessert sitting at our table not ordered. And my husband joke to that perhaps this was a Mother's Day offering. The waiter then came back over with my hazelnut gelato, took the other one that I didn't order and also took the trio away without apologizing or saying a word. Very odd indeed. I'm so frustrated because I wanted so badly to love this place, it is less than five minutes from my house in the lakes. The whole experience was beyond strange, and that even spoke to the table sitting next to me, and they were complaining that the waiters forgot to put in part of their food order. I have to say the Hispanic woman that was taking care of refilling our drinks was absolutely wonderful, looking back I should've tipped her directly. I really am frustrated, and I do wish that the owners or managers way to train their staff to be more efficient and communicative. I'm on sure if I'll return at this point. We are enjoying our food yes. Was the service Bizzarre? Absolutely. I believe my husband still has the receipt from the restaurant, and if he does, I may be calling the restaurant today because the whole situation was just very odd. We left feeling confused. The food can be fantastic, but if the service is lacking, we most likely won't be returning. And I'm sure for every person that complains about the service publicly, there's 10 or 15 that don't, and simply will not visit your establishment again. Please do something about this.

oed-B2pUZlVwr75XAJwQeA.text: OHMY GOSH IT IS SO GOOD!! My best Italian restaurant from now on! Trust me and come to this place and you will be the winner

Lf16fEJa-wmI1CYb3mBtUw.text: I ordered the NY steak and the gf ordered the sausage spagetti, and both the dishes were terrible.  The gf says that "a homemade spagetti with newmans best sauce"  would have been better.  I can't disagree.  The NY steak smelled and tasted horrible.  They had to slice up the steak, which is a bad sign right away on a piece of meat.  You wonder if it was too tough or in this case since it had some kind of smell, I wondered if the meat was bad.   I took half of it home and when I reheated it, it had a really really strong meat smell.  They also topped it with some kind of cheese, (cheese on steak? )  but anyways, I just thought it was to mask the smell.    I never rate on establishment, looks, service, etc.  I thought everything was ok.  I go to the restaruant for the food, and what I ordered was lackluster, bad quality and horrid.  never coming here again. ever.  I read a lot of good reviews about the cold cuts.  Maybe thats what I should have ordered. who knows.  But I'm sure not gonna find out.  Edit:  Oh wait, I did like the complimentary bread and the garlic pesto butter.  The shrimp scampi appetizer was okay.  That was standard, until the maincourse  and stinky meat showed itself up.

9pr66TIXnlVGU140Eb9K1w.text: This review is for the deli and bar area, not the main dining restaurant.   The Deli's service is mediocre at best. However, the food is great. At the deli, I've had the Siena sandwich, sausage and peppers sandwich, and the prosciutto sandwich; bruschetta, tiramisu, gelato, and latte. All the food has been really good.   My favorite is the sausage and peppers sandwich. Marinara sauce + sausage + peppers + onions = ONE AMAZING SANDWICH!!  Latte's are strong and very flavorful coffee.   There are lots of Italian-type merchandise products for sale. Olives, pasta, olive oil, sauce, peppers, and etc.   The dining area has very nice interior, but I've never eaten there before. I've had a drink at the bar area. On a Thursday night, the bar was almost completely full.   Tuesday-Sunday's have live bands from 8-close.   Happy hr is from 3-7 everyday; reverse hh from 9-close; happy hour all day Sunday.

t6ZjIUaMzmos88QMdXOBmw.text: We had dinner here on Friday night.  We both had the Marcela chicken, one order was with mashed potatoes and I had mine with Fettuccini noodles both dinners were very good.  There was a singer there to that was very entertaining and made our dinner enjoyable. The only reason I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 was they didn't offer Shiraz as a wine choice  All in all our experience was very enjoyable and we will return soon.

FToRr8mIA-GKYrjw856eIw.text: One of my new favorite restaurants. Great long Happy Hour prices in a bar with a nice crowd buzz.  Size of drinks are generous. Ate in the restaurant area and had the 14oz. NY steak with polenta and asparagus. It was delicious and for only $25. Good bread and service. Everyone enjoyed their meal at our table. Will definitely be hanging out here.

The deli was nice also pick'd up some goodies for later in the week~    Started off with prosciutto & mozzarella very pretty presentation and quite tasty too! Ordered pizza  which was good, but not great~thin crust which was nice, topped with olives, artichoke hearts &  proscuitto. The sauce was not to flavorful~     Out server was nice & attentive. SUMMERLIN is a bit far for us, however if in the area I would DEFINATLY try Sienna again and go for the pasta

bFuR5qKDhf_KTZdrtFWfXA.text: Props to Tetto for helping me out of having to make homemade manicotti this year! Making the handmade crepes takes hours and I just wasn't up to it, but my kids expect it every year! Also, they have sfogliatelle frozen so I can bake them myself!  I will definitely come back to get all the delicious looking meats and pastas!  Thanks Tetto!

HRP8iyrIjEZTrjqrfTl58w.text: My favorite place in town for calamari!  They also have an awesome happy hour and some really great wines. We love to go in for drinks and a few apps. Dinner is somewhat expensive but if you're not on a budget, this is a great Italian restaurant.  Sit at the bar for awesome service!

5eFvX4biQ8aidKdCWXxyqw.text: The first time I went to Siena it was absolutely amazing. So much so that we talked about the food many times between December and this visit. I came in to town to visit family and this place was number 1 on my to visit list. We dined in on a Thursday evening. It wasn't very busy and we were seated right away. The best thing I had that evening was the appetizer of different cured meats and cheeses. It is $24 so a bit expensive, but we shared it among 4 people. You can tell everything is fresh cut and it was just delicious. The other appetizer we shared were the mussels. In December, the mussels were amazing, buttery, and no fishy taste at all. This time not so much. We couldn't even finish them they were so fishy. It was a disappointment for sure. For our entrees I got the linguini with clams. Again, very disappointed. The clams were full of sand and the sauce had absolutely no taste. What a bummer. I was really looking forward to this meal and it just didn't deliver. I am hoping it was an off night for them. I will be back again and hopefully have a similar experience to my December visit. If you do go, splurge for the cured meat platter. It really is worth it.

GeIFdFVSKoP2FprSUf2-1Q.text: The place has two sides, a deli (on the right) and the Trattoria on the left. I've enjoyed both! Tried the deli side yesterday, and it was exactly the treat that I'd been hoping for. It's a nice well lit open space, lots of fresh stuff, desserts, breads, meats, cheeses. I had a sandwich and it was perfect. My previous visit was for dinner with a medium sized group and the food and service were fantastic! I'll happily drive an hour to get there. Worth it!

VGFLfJFtSEgXHYsYd-JjBg.text: This is my very favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas.  Service - perfect.  Food - Outstanding.    They have specials every night and when they have the Branzino (Striped Bass), it is what I order.  They serve it table side, de-boning and plating the fish and vegetables right in front of you.  The lemon caper sauce is delicious, I always ask for a little extra.  No matter what you order on the special menu, it is fresh and in season and wonderful.  We have friends that we go with quite a bit, and one of our companions orders the Chicken Marsala every time.  It is his favorite dish and he can't get away from it.  Order the charcuterie plate for appetizer.  Onsite they have an Italian shop with meats, cheeses, olives, gelato, and other worldly goodies.  The meat and cheeses on the plate are from the shop.  The portion is very generous - quite enough for four or five people.   The menu is just enough of everything Italian from the appetizers, salads, pizza and traditional Italian dishes.  Everything we have ordered has been fabulous.  This is definitely our "go-to" Italian place!

The veal was dry, the chicken was not cooked, cmon you guys used to be great, was 1 of my davorites for business dinners or lunch, but dont think i will be back!

4P7LA4mWxEWF0l_v_jtb2Q.text: Very delightful, restaurant was very good, good service, we even went into the market and took home some dessert and some Manhattan Specials, they need to make some Black and White cookies though

QcJtn5M2YNGxhdhISa80PA.text: Food was great and out server Sebastian was amazing!!!

zcIMjIU-hpEoyVRm4I2lWg.text: We went for Saturday lunch with a party of 4 and were seated right away.  The service was fine and the apps were excellent, as was the Caesar salad.  The main issue with this visit was that apparently there was only one chef available, as it took 1 hour from finishing the apps to the arrival of the main courses.  My Pesce misto was flavorless, with the fish very dry.  Other entrees also lacked flavor.

jLLrsDUXGgByXgeKgSbNig.text: This is the best Italian deli in Nevada. I don't mind driving accross town. I by lunch , and food to go. Awesome bakery..

mJjoctvKCHsc0wTnMbBHQg.text: OVERPRICED. Why is the best thing about this place the drinks? So for a temporary time, brunch on Sunday will be $10 for bottomless mimosas or bloody Mary's. They say this will be for summer only since this is their slow season. The entire place is very pretty, with the wood fired stone oven in the back, the big bar area, and the deli. We had a large party and I'm not sure how many times we had to ask for refills on the drinks. Is this how they save money? Disappearing act when you order bottomless mimosas?   Nothing pisses me off more than having to buy the complimentary bread at a table. $3.50 for hard crispy bread that comes with preserves that taste like Smuckers. No thanks.  French toast - 1/5 $10 it's like they're trying to hide the fact that the portion size is so small. It's laughable. Cut up strawberries do not hide the fact you gave us a crap portion size for what we paid for. The bread is extremely thin. Just... horrible. It said it was going to come with mascarpone and it didn't.   Pepper and egg sandwich: 2/5 $8.95 Nothing special.  Bread is good but not particularly warm. "Why is this so expensive?" Are my thoughts on all the food we ordered. Nobody seemed particularly satisfied with their food in our 9 person party.   The one thing we seemed to agree on was the potatoes were good. That's it. Food was just such shit for the prices.   Please don't make alcohol your strong point of your restaurant.

MGSpSR9igVQ4USC5MLG__g.text: Coming to this place is great it's  The reel deal handmade everything  They even have a bakery there fresh Everything you're cannoli is stuffed  In front of you

Y5y__Ar5SJa5J1ClKkvkgw.text: Growing up, my step-dad was first generation American. His parents were from Northern Italy and I became very discerning when it comes to Italian Food. This place knocks it out of the park.  The first time we came, we ate in the Deli and were very impressed with the huge variety of meat and cheeses. The next time, we ate in the restaurant and were pleased with the service and the food.  We shared an Antipasto Salad, My wife had Insalata Con Salmone and I had the Pesto Gnocchi. A couple of glasses of wife, dessert and coffee and we were stuffed. Great portions and flavors.

5Z9uarFIuPc1FJ-FYotE6A.text: This place reminds me of back east southern New England and New York  authentic Italian food! The Chicken Parm is the bomb. The deli sandwiches are marvelous also. The sauce is exactly what I remember growing up and eating in the Italian section of Hartford Conn. Yummo! I think I'll have a pepper, egg and cheese Grinder, Hoagie, Submarine or whatever you prefer to call it. NOW!

MXqk0y25_G0icTM0eZ80_Q.text: The Goods 1. Bakery and deli on one side with small Italian grocery store.  This place came highly recommended by a friend especially the frutti di mare.  They are known for Italian desserts.   2. I loved the bread basket, as I usually do, with the tapenade it is like crack in spread form!! 3. Bruschetta was a little soggy from the tomatoes.  The bread could have been a bit more toasty 4. I had the best best white zin here - Bel Arbor from California.  Usually I don't get anything out of a glass of wine but this one definitely had a taste of grapefruit, and I finally finished a glass of wine.   5. Entree didn't have the best presentation but the piccata sauce was delicious nicely tangy.   6. Desserts are Italian favorites!  I got the sampler   Service 1. Server was great!!!   2. Front desk and bakery was less friendly.   3. I felt like it was harsh, maybe this is Italian style   Ambiance 1. Ambiance in other photos mainly showed the deli but the sit down restaurant is more sleek and modern 2. See photos   MoJo 1. Try everything!  I wanted to try the sfogliatella, but they were fresh out :(

lCTZLMoXs5-UaC7GunMg6A.text: Love this place! Cloth napkins, white tablecloths, servers know every detail of the menu and it's ingredients. Lots of choices and everything I've ever ordered was delicious. Since I don't eat meat, they are very accommodating on substitutions. Go early, it gets very busy and noise level escalates. Happy hour: 4:00 - 7:00 with some great appetizers on their happy hour menu.  East side of restaurant is their deli. Get a custom made sandwich for lunch tomorrow or a pastry for breakfast!

iJO1tbC-yz7yFfxbIof5hg.text: Good authentic Italian food!! Price are so reasonable new. I loved the cannoli and chicken Marsala. The plates portions are a little light for dinner but I frequent Cheesecake Factory and they really stack a plate. I will order an extra side next time! Delicious

_QSw1vc2XWLWJ9EoOzrE1w.text: Amazing customer service.  Angela the Baker went above and beyond. I stopped in after work to pick up Sfogliatella (an amazing pastry) for Fathers Day. They already sold out. Angela took care of me. Thank you Curtis for your smile and all your help!

28XO5BGZk2DnY9t9jlvQQA.text: We were at Village Square for an early afternoon movie and wanted to meet friends for dinner close by. They recommended Siena Italian. It is literally around the corner and was an excellent choice. Our server, Sebastian, came to our table almost immediately take a drink orders. We were early enough for happy hour so I went with draft beer ($3.75). For my entree, I ordered one of their specials, a lobster tail with shrimp and scallops and  black ink pasta. Always risky to order a lobster tail in a restaurant that doesn't specialize in seafood but I love black ink pasta so I thought I'd give it a try. Great choice! The lobster tail was succulent. The shrimp and scallops were fresh and tasty. And black ink pasta was absolutely delicious. My wife went with a salad and the happy hour baby lamb chops. Also excellent choices. I definitely will return the next time I am at the Village Square theater around dinner time.

kSudo3d51jIsNRrcPRU3Wg.text: One our favorite stops. Today my grandson Jack (11) and I are here for lunch. Jack said isn't this the pace that has the great meat & cheese appetizer (antipasto). Yes the kid knows a great deli when he see's one. But the connected deli is in addition to the fine dining restaurant and upscale bar that hosts live music on the weekends. The menu and specials are classic Italian with a modern flair. My family and I have had dozens of meals here, including my daughter's wedding rehearsal dinner. They have also catered 150 people in our back yard. All my experiences here have been 5+stars. We are loyal life time patrons.

Portion was so massive that when you leave the table you feel like you ate for 2 days!! Went with family and each one of us left very satisfied and we are very picky eaters!!!! I would definitely come back here and recommend it to all my friends!! Their wine selection is awesome also!!!

7vPUX8HoyDrE_8gAZVCYLw.text: Came to the deli on a recommendation from my doctors office. Got the chicken parmigiana sandwich, the chicken and spinach sandwich, an order of meatballs and some cookies. ALL amazing. Good quality flavorful food. Thought the service was very friendly. Sat out on the patio and had lunch. 2 sandwiches, 3 meatballs, 7 cookies and a water was $30. Very affordable! The deli area is adorable with pastas and sauces and grocery items. Not from this area but wish we had a place like this where we are from!

1Dzo15Z8qk8DdbqsbVRMRg.text: My family comes from Frosinone Italy, this is the most authentic Italian restaurant in Las Vegas! When I come here, whether it's just the deli or in the restaurant for dining, I am taken back to Italy. Fresh and amazing are the words I think of when I eat here! GianCarlo's heart is in his restaurant and he cares very much about customer satisfaction. We love it here and highly recommend it for everyone who wants to experience a taste of Italy in Las Vegas!

G50gIId8d2Cab2hlS7KlGg.text: I don't know why the low ratings. Our meals were beyond excellent. The service was great and the deserts are outstanding. Don't let anyone keep you from trying this

vrsnqC3dDSfwaI850QegxA.text: Second time at this restaurant great atmosphere lovely staff! For mine and my fiance's meal wine dessert and coffee came out to be $130 which is super cheap i totally forgot the name of my dinner it was a NY Steak though which was so good it did not need any salt or pepper the fruit tart was probably the best I've had yet. Oh and you have to order the calamari when you go it is nice and crispy some restaurants that I've been to there calamari is soggy and tastes under cooked so I was happy this one was not like that! The wine was light bodied and amazing paired nicely with the steak and my fiance said that the cappuccino here was the best he's every had !

Fwa7j05tLPwNh0M6ODRdsw.text: If you're looking for great food, atmosphere, drinks, and music...you need look no further than Siena.   My wife loves Antonio's Special Choice, and my favorite is the lasagna.  If you're looking for a place to take your sweetheart out to dinner, this is the place.  The live music is outstanding.  Music by Ray and Mandi is a must see and hear.   They have an unbelievable sound and fantastic selection in music.   I especially like the way they perform "Just My Imagination".      If you're looking to just have lunch during the week, the deli is unbelievable.   I love the Sicilian, and the sausage & pepper hoagie is awesome as well.  Don't forget to top your lunch, breakfast or dinner off with an espresso!   My birthday's coming up...we'll be there.

S72uDUAImroZZrFF43rTfA.text: We were so disappointed in Anna Marie Italian restaurant we left and came to Siena greeted by the manager with a smile and  without having a reservation for 8 people we were seated together, honored the happy hour menu and drinks! We enjoyed a lovely meal together the service was exceptional! The end of our meal Lola the manager stopped by informed us they gave live music and dance on weekends and we are welcome to check it out! We felt like part of the True Italian family in Siena! Will be back for the exceptional service the wonderful extensive happy hour menu and we also would like to thank the servers and the management to restore our started out horrible evening into a pleasantly wonderful evening with our friends!  5 star customer service and 5 star menu and drinks as well! Highly recommended restaurant with excellent service! Please come and enjoy great food and great service with your group or family!Enjoy!

_Ejt19sSg7f7flr-j-BPJw.text: Omg the band called exo STUCKS!!! They tuned the drums for  hour & half peatng the drums it was so loud I will never come back to hear this again!!!!

R9pHldBLSVXcstQUVh88OQ.text: Came again and had some delicious dinner. Seafood tasted amazing.    We'll be back.  Sad to see that there isn't any more dancing :(.

33Ju4ByVTu5onlrV7t6eMQ.text: Becoming a favorite spot. The penne a la vodka without meat is my favorite. Good salads and drinks. Great brunch menu, the stuffed avacado was perfect and the bottomless mimosas are great.

KuO77xip5z6L8eXze9qmuw.text: Yes the food is authentic and very good.  Good value for the money too.  Try the homemade gnocchi with the marinara sauce.  I recently had an issue with the food and the manager was rude.

CtUmpbDzZRq_7TvoGVc4fQ.text: I have been eating at Seina Deli for about 20 years, the food is always perfect, the service is always perfect. The Deli makes in my opinion the best sandwiches in Vegas. The restaurant next door is top notch also. My only problem with the place is they moved. :( working at the airport, I can't run over there a get lunch anymore. Now I have to drive to the other side of town.

2WhQqETZpnUbGKy6p-_fig.text: I am writing this review to thank the staff for giving my daughter and her friends an amazing dinner for their Senior Prom.    With large group of 12 they were having a hard time deciding where to go for dinner.  Others in the group had suggested going to  Brio but my daughter wanted to make her senior prom the most special one yet.  I had been to Siena a few years ago so I took her to check it out.  She LOVED it!!  It really took some convincing of her friends but she really wanted to get her way....she wasn't going anywhere else but here.  They all had a great time.  She said the staff was so great.  The checks were all split up as needed with no problems, they never had to ask for refills and the ambiance was beautiful.  She said everyone loved their orders with one exception.  The vodka sauce, calamari, other seafood dishes were amazing, but the the lasagna was the only dish that wasn't loved.    I had been nervous sending a large group of teenagers to a nice restaurant.  I was afraid they wouldn't be treated as well as maybe a group of adults would.  I am so pleased that this was not the case!    Thank you thank you thank you!!

k7ISsN8efCUgwyqBeYIkyA.text: semi fabu enough italian specialty counter....all standard fare...serviceable enough that I have found especially for this side of the valley. all lovely...when the counter staff actually acknowledges your presence. if you can take the lacking service in stride....happy antipasto plates for your home abound.

mNlUONm7DEaJBPW3-nXHrA.text: Iced tea is good. Not rancid as in when they do not clean the container Bread is suboptimal. Plenty of olive oil and balsamic plus olive dip. But bread is not fresh or of quality. This ruined most of the first impression. Don't understand why compromise on the first impression to a costumer.  Cannelloni from the lunch menu does not say anything. Sauce is mediocre and meat made me think of frozen packaged food.  Overall experience: great atmosphere, franchise food.

ECIvOsjPR0SYa-GR0un-0Q.text: It's a cute little neighborhood Italian spot, and I was always curious about it because the parking lot is always full. The food and service were okay. The bar area is cute and it has a really cute atmosphere. I probably won't go back though.

OmIU8WTSbmC_tOzJZIXBSw.text: Finally made it to Siena Italian after driving by daily and wanting to check it out since I moved back to Vegas a year ago. The food was fantastic! We started with the Burrata and Heirloom tomato followed by a salad (I forget the name) with mixed greens, toasted walnuts, gorgonzola and sliced apples. Entrees at the table were the Veal Piccata, Tagliata di Manzo, a New Zealand Snapper special and a Grouper special. All were exceptional and very reasonably priced. We finished with a couple desserts and more satisfied we could not have been. Service? Probably would have to give that 3 stars. Our server was very nice but not very detail oriented and not very attentive.  We didnt get an appetizer we ordered (which may have not been his fault) and we got a cappuccino instead of an espresso that my sister ordered. It wasn't very busy and for the quality of the food and beautiful decor that they have, I feel the service should be a bit more attentive and professional. I will definitely be back because the food was so good but maybe next time sit in the bar. Live music on Friday was a nice addition too.

1_BbZT-lW0ANJv0PBqvcOQ.text: Really good italian food. Good service.  No chicken parm on menu but they made it for me. Can you say 5 stars on seamless?

k3cErjBAwfeUzv95B0KOcg.text: Dinner Thursday February 15th.  We decided to go and try Siena.  A birthday celebration.  I brought a small cake and candle for the occasion. More about that later.  2 of us ordered chix parm over angel hair pasta.  Very good. The birthday girl ordered the recommended salmon, grilled over spinach. Great.  I ordered a pizza, good and a small caesar salad.  All and all the food was very good. The service was excellent.  Now let me finish my cake story.  Our waiter served the cake and we all sang, we had a very nice time, that is until the waiter brought us yne bill.  He said that there was a service charge for the cake service.  Not a problem I thought until I noticed the amount.  $20.00 service charge.  $10.00 would have been fine but $20.00 is excessive, no rediculous.  When I asked the manager she seemed puzzled, she said she would check with the manager and just went about her business.  Not a great way to run a business, what due think?  When i handed her the cake upon arrival she did not mention a charge.

1iJrSqEkcVPsvZE15KTyIA.text: Im going to miss being able to walk here.  I come here mostly for the deli which serves fresh bread, sausage in and out of the casing, fresh sauces and homemade pasta at reasonable prices.  Fed three people lobster ravioli with alfredo sauce, a baguette, a half pound of sausage(out of casing) and had plenty of leftover sauce.    In the restaurant the food is very good.  I have never had any meal that I could say was a disappointment.  What keeps it from a 5th star is that I have also never had a meal that knocked my socks off.  The staff is always friendly, helpful with the menu and suggestions, and on top of the water and bread baskets.  The seating could be a little more on the comfort side of things but the no frills approach probably keeps the prices from escalating out of control.  I enjoy coming here with the family and it is a good date spot as well.

mHVNG2Kfmga8m1kexlsDDg.text: This is for the restaurant: All of the Yelp reviewers criticizing this establishment are spot on... Server? Rude. Very rude. I also had to keep reminding the person to bring me things I requested earlier. I finally gave up.  Food? Not great. My entree had over cooked pasta. My dining companion's lasagne had cold meatballs in it. My cookies looked and tasted old. I bit into one and it literally crumbled into pieces. I ended up "trying" them all, but eating only one.  Entertainment? A bit loud, but the band was tight and the drummer was amazing.  Do I recommend? Like other Yelp reviewers said, you'd think this place would try harder to present "authentic" Italian food when there's so much competition here in Vegas. So no, I do not recommend this restaurant. This was my second visit with the same experience.

NnaZ-WoBod8AcPfZ6hMw7w.text: UNREAL happy hour menu at the bar (check out the photos I posted)!  All the items are full sized and yummy. Had the calamari and the eggplant Parmesan as an appetizer. Both were huge and darn near enough for a small entree. For main course got the penne a la vodka and added scallops... Fantastic!  Also had the seafood special risotto. Really good as well. If Julio is working the bar, he won't lead you wrong. This is now my "go to" Sunday dinner spot when in Vegas. Check it out. You won't be sorry.

-BTIvgIlGbf9TD6Ml_gQ9A.text: When you walk into this place it's kind of intimidating with all the pasta and sauces and olives to purchase but after about five seconds you learn how wonderful it is to have a place like this.     The people are always nice and helpful with all the choices. Now, I've only had lunch here but if the diner is as good as the lunch, I bet its spectacular! I always get the Sicilian Sandwich and it's on the mark, I can't understand how this simple sandwich is so good but I could never get my sandwiches to taste that good. The bread is fresh and the meat well is from the deli so its awesome.    My only complaint would be not having a soda fountain in the deli/lunch area but they do have bottled soda and water    I'm a huge cannoli fan so when I can get one to try I do, they have three sizes sm. med, large so went for the Med not knowing the size difference. I should have went for the large cause the med seemed small. They have a lot of deserts to try and I look forward to trying more. All the frozen pasta I've bought and cooked at home has been wonderful. So, If you want a good sandwich go for the Sicilian or chicken parmesan they are outstanding.

2TDJaIQaFb0qg7kKEiI2TQ.text: We love this restaurant because of the service and authenticity of the food.  The recipes are True Italian and nicely plated. I love the eggplant parmigiana and linguine with clams. Desserts are nicely sized for sharing.  Definitely a location for a special occasion.  Live music in the bar on certain nights adds a nice touch.

CxSqv5ljdAbuqqy-1iSerQ.text: Haven't been here in years and not sure if I will soon.  Upon entry hostess seemed to have s shitty attitude it was like " oh excuse me for walking in your restaurant".  Service staff is pretty good I guess lucky and didn't get the waitress with attitude from another review.   As for the food, well nothing to hit home about. Chopped salad was so-so, eggplant was like someone shaved it really fine to make slices. Sauce was just bland, tasted like any other place or Olive Garden   Rather go to Marc's down the street or Paymons  for pasta

UkZIiYI6cutmceOQYuxM7A.text: I had only been in the deli and market before.  The restaurant is very nice. I really like the look of it. The booths are very comfortable.  They start you out with delicious crusty Italian bread, with a tasty olive spread. That alone will keep me coming back.  My husband enjoyed his frutti de mare. There was not a morsel of food left in his plate. My friend had  the stuffed rigatoni. She said the flavor was the best she has had in a very long time. I had the special. The Pecchari. I liked it it was just a little under seasoned.  We were too full for desserts.  We stopped in the deli and picked up some items, including the olive spread.  We will be back here, beautiful place, great service, good prices. Very good food.

U2k3Bke-sjbHH2kPjB1NcQ.text: Came here after trying to get service at Nacho Daddy next door.   Upon entering we were quickly greeted by the bartender who promptly took our order and brought us our drinks.   The atmosphere was much better than next door and so many good choices of drinks and appetizers for their happy hour.   Slightly older crowd without the pounding music you get at some of the other happy hour places. Classy place.

vscop0hxuIGwrOIgEGQ8Sg.text: Great place for italian food. Price point is excellent.  You can choose from the deli side or the sit down restaurant.  Bar has Great happy hour. Service was average. Linguini clams are great and pasta carbonara.  Yummy. Will definitely go back.

PnZ9Dd7hkWVBI5WnQeOu8w.text: Bartender white with the beard needs to get a new job only pays attention to regulars I ordered a drink and an app That somebody brought Out to me never received a silverware even though he was in front of me he never checked on  me wanted to order dinner but he never came back ,a nice asian man with glasses that everybody was happy to see refill my drink and after I watched my bartender  pay attention  to everybody else but me I decided to leave the Asian man told him I was ready to go and it was about 20 minutes before he ever came over to me the Asian man told him twice  you will never grow new customer with this form of attention    Will not go back

U-ePOqR-cuqR3beV30n67A.text: The first thing I liked was I walked in and the deli area is amply stocked with lots of various items,it reminded me of a place I always went to in burbank. so I started asking questions about the menu and the gentleman,who I assume was at least a manager or an owner didn't exactly have answers to simple questions,which precipitated an additional extra 5 minutes of uneccesary converstation. I ordered the chicken parm. sandwhich and some Italian wedding soup,I got my dad the spaghetti and meatballs but had them sub in an arrabiatta sauce to kick it up a notch. both of our meals were very good..the soup was excellent. While I was waiting around for the food I inspected the many items they had stocked on their shelves...everything I looked at had past due expiration dates..that's a big deal for me..it indicates a lack of professionalism and selling items less fresh then they should be because they don't want to dump inventory. they could at least discount  the past due items. then there was also an overall blase attitude like these guys were still in europe..they were authentic they all spoke Italian but they also had the urgency of italians...slow boat from china.....these are the few items I deducted for...

GIsNp6qGwK0_8-XscySAfA.text: I can't just say anything nice about this place. From the beginning, it gave me an impression that we were not going to enjoy our experience here. I try not to be negative or biased at  but the service here started from horrible to ending just plain terrible. When the server came and got our drink orders he wasn't enthusiastic at all. I don't understand why people are in this industry if they don't like their job. It leaves customers with a negative experience. BUT, for this place it was the server, busser and manager. They were not on the same page at all. After like 10 minutes go by, we finally get our drinks. So, I keep my cool and brush that off to the side. 15 minutes go by, we finally get to order our food. When we order, we wanted a substitution for a dressing since we did not like the ingredient with the dressing that the salad came with. The server  gave us the dirtiest and most disgusted look like what we asked for was just plain wrong. Look, food was decent and thats what gave this restaurant 2 stars. Other than that, service = negative 5 stars. When I read some of the reviews of this place being that service sucked, yeah I still gave it a shot here because it could be just a bad apple. After today, the server, busser and manager, they just want your money and don't care about how you get service. GO EAT AT SOME OTHER ITALIAN JOINT, THIS PLACE IS A WASTE OF YOUR MONEY!

EC0Mq8ISpJLkdA_4aQaOvw.text: One of my favorite places for Happy Hour here in Summerlin! Staff is friendly and the HH prices can not be beat! PLUS, HH lasts ALL.DAY.LONG on Sundays #signmeup

HX2oqot7NBiLMJ2TZlT3KA.text: My husband and a few of his close friends tried this place for lunch one day and had a great lunch! He was so pleased with his experience he wanted to take me there for dinner. We started with calamari which was so greasy we could hardly eat it. The pieces were literally dripping with grease.  For main course I ordered the special of the day which was seared ahi tuna. It was charred and totally cooked thru. It was more like a tough steak than a piece of fish. I sent it back and ordered the salmon instead. The salmon was burned as well and so salty it was inedible.  Needless to say we left and had to eat elsewhere.  The bright light is the service. Friendly and attentive! The staff made an awful dining experience somewhat tolerable.  Needless to say I won't be dining again here unless things really change in the kitchen!

5F7NuqzgYnBqh9SsGH415w.text: Big fan of the sandwiches and entrees made to order and carry out.

5Pc9eVfe31F_wcC_93nLzg.text: I enjoy eating at the bar. The food is good but not great. Had some pasta and it was very good. Bartenders very attentive and a nice over 40 crowd. Great place to grab a quick bite and socialize.

Q5yNU0pK7omYA0BuUYj36g.text: Had friends from out of town who wanted to eat Italian.   We came here and the atmosphere was great.  We had appetizers, salad, entrees and dessert.   The food was great.  The service was excellent.  We were allowed to relax and enjoy our meal.   One side is a bar and the other is the restaurant.  When we were leaving I noticed they had live music in the bar.  This is a great local bar and restaurant.   We will definitely be back.   I loved everything I ate.

LeRqZFGdSXChSUr7KRYItA.text: Friends in Summerlin constantly share stories of the best restaurants in Summerlin. We hike and they name all the restaurants they eat at. All those restaurant reviews included Siena - The name for the Italian restaurant continues to come up in conversation for their dishes. From the drivers of the Cadillac car clubs that meet at Village Center to City Hall spokespeople who walk the trails of Red Rock outside Charleston on the weekends, everyone including the Las Vegas fire fighters state, "Siena Italian Trattoria has the best pizza. Their pasta sauces have the most flavor. Siena makes their own pasta - Homemade pasta. Siena has a deli next to the restaurant." Christmas Eve after a long day starting in the early morning, we found ourselves near Rabbi Wyne's synagogue to give him a Hanukkah present, and directly across the street was the famous Siena restaurant we have heard about for months. So we literally walked over, which is great about Summerlin, it is one of the few communities in Las Vegas where people can actually walk from the library to the restaurant, from the deli to the grocery store. The most unique restaurant with a terrific wine menu, Siena's deli has smoked meats, grilled meat cutlets breaded, pasta salads, gelato ice creams, fresh baked breads, Italian cookies. The restaurant served up seafood linguine homemade with a white cheese Alfredo sauce combined with steamed lobster, scallops, abalone, clams and grilled shrimp with shaved green onion that added such a nice touch to the white dish as well as taste. Honestly the texture of the linguine was perfect. The chef did a great job. The service was also extraordinary. Many people waited on us. Our table constantly had fresh olive sauces for dipping with new loaves of baked bread brought to our table. After hearing so much about the pastas from friends, we also ordered the hand stuffed rigatoni. Rigatoni rolls stuffed with shrimp and mushrooms into the pasta rolls. The light golden sauce reminded me to the tomato cream for Penne a la Vodka, but had brandy added which tasted different from other tomato sauces.

N5YmsqkhfVkR7jOhMkiUQg.text: Very nice dinner, and very authentic Italian.   Three out of four diners in our party loved their entree's, while fourth was a bit bland.   Service was very good, and atmosphere is also nice, with live music playing in the bar.  While we live aboug 45 minutes away, not sure I would come back that often, but if we lived closer, we would for sure be there often.

TehEq1m4DIWJcxFmQ69SAg.text: The food is delicious with a lot of selection I don't normally see at Italian restaurants. The waiters are such characters. The tapenade they give you with bread is heavenly. The atmosphere feels high end but it's reasonably priced. I haven't had a single thing here I don't like. The only negative: they use styrofoam. I really wish they would adopt a more eco friendly option for their containers.

temDDeF-u3cfJP8FjmdDUw.text: Not Thrilled,sauce had no flavor, bread was old and not what a Italian restaurant should serve, ate a spaghetti bolognese and I left hungry I felt the portion was small, overpriced, no flavor, gonna try a different place because I wouldn't go back.

pd1YvD21fygInMB4F2oU8A.text: I stopped by recently for a sandwich.  It was great & the potatoe salad was very good.  The do not take pictures signs are down!   The service was excellent.  The two guys that helped me at the sandwich area and the checkout were very nice.  Yes I will go back. .

AmCfghZaljkgQkF_88MUZg.text: My favorite part of eating here is going to the attached store to buy authentic Italian ingredients. The store has all types of pasta, canned goods, fresh cheeses and meats. You can get prepared foods as well such as slices of pizza and pasta salads. The restaurant has great food as well. I've tried the gnocci with pesto it was very good. The bar also make one of the best Negroni's in town.

L00k6_qEzB7O-LW4BC2tKw.text: We came here for a family dinner and while it wasn't a complete disaster, it wasn't good enough to warrant a return visit. The wife's raviolis were probably frozen because the insides were still cold. The presentation of my lasagna was nice -- sitting in a little sauce pan -- but the sauce was a little bland and there wasn't much meat in the lasagna.   They don't have a kids menu but they suggested a slice of pizza from their deli instead of a regular sized pizza. We thought it was a good idea since he doesn't eat much, but after seeing the quality of the "pizza" they brought out we regretted the decision. First of all, they forgot the order and we had to remind them. It finally arrived well after the wife and I got our meals. What they brought out was a square pizza that looked like it was made that morning or earlier. They just tossed some cheese on top and reheated it. The quality of it was awful.  We did flag down a manager and voiced our concerns. She was nice enough and apologized, even taking the pizza off the check. They offered to comp dessert but we declined.  The restaurant was packed with plenty of older Summerlin folk. That's neither a compliment nor a condemnation, just an observation. It may be popular with some people, but not with us.

22JCgCiWF1LNCNtx5zQtUg.text: Great set up with a bar section, table dining and a deli. Good solid food and great atmosphere for either of the three you are looking for! Great Owner.... Check this place out!

SJ3-7wQGRoYsMJj02kUEmg.text: First time trying this place. Uninspiring food, I decided to have calamari and gnocchi with pesto. Calamari was tender But I wish the batter was lighter and the marinara that it came with was no so heavy with tomatoes. Gnocchi was a disaster, it was soo mushy... I could only eat 1/3 of it. I'm not a person who sends back stuff. I decided not to finish it, just won't be back for another helping.

3-sUvzY0WjmWV07Q3LV3Dg.text: Good food. Poor service.  Under staffed during lunch.  Servers are trying their best to take care of too many people. Bar was unmanned for the majority of the time I was there. Simply put... poorly managed

xaDsrq23KrKSR-9MtTm_dg.text: This place is the BEST - and in my humble opinion the only Italian deli you should even go to in Las Vegas. Their sandwiches are so good, so authentic and fresh. Everything is cut and made in house. The cannoli with fresh cream... I mean just wow. Lemon zest. Chocolate chips. Homemade shells. And THE BREAD. I can literally talk about everything here. JGzOrTbOmIjWpTXpgknIVQ.text: Came here for Valentines Day dinner. Great server, made the experience a whole lot better.  Only downside was the limited menu - understandable but didn't have carbonara or chicken parm :(.   Caesar salad was overly dressed and seemed to be only the white/yellow end parts of lettuce (not even green lol) and hardly any croutons with it.  Other salad had stale walnuts and was disappointing.   Lasagna was good but needed more sauce. Martini was fine.  Don't know if we would come back, it was just okay.

39IGABkIdqkow7PdfPS1dw.text: Went here on a Saturday afternoon with another couple, and three dining area and bar were pretty empty, which seemed to run counter to the rather slow service we received. They gave us copious amounts of bread to snack on, which was nice. I ordered the pepperoni pizza, which was decent but not nearly the best I've had in Vegas. The spaghetti and meatballs was flavorful, but the meatballs were surprisingly small. They don't have draft beer, only bottles, which disappointed me. They played a lot of sad, slow songs over the speakers, which was kinda depressing. We shared a bottle of red wine, which was just okay. I give it a C for the service, a C for the food, a B for the atmosphere, and a C for the price, because this place should really be rated three dollar signs. Better pizza is available elsewhere, for sure

rZLzYtAjIOLtwxXNr7fxlg.text: Lately I've been visiting local Italian restaurants and Siena was previously on my bookmarked but I haven't got the chance to try this place out. Until my most recent visit with my family, because it was my parents 36th wedding anniversary. They wanted something new to try out oppose to the norm and being Filipino my parents are biased to Asian cuisine. However, we decided to try this place out and was pleasantly surprised how delicious the food is. I do appreciate how spacious the restaurant is with 3 separate sections with the bar/lounge to the left once you enter. There is a main dinning room in the middle that had an intimate and modern appeal with a cool looking see-through wine room. Then to the far right side is the quick deli and market with imported Italian food.  Based on our dinner and service. My family and I were impress with the awesome service. Order was taken in a timely manner and came out according to our preference with appetizers to the main courses. The bruschetta was a favorite of ours, especially the fresh diced tomatoes and sauce even the texture of the bread was consistent without being too soggy or crispy. Calamari was breaded just right! So far appetizers were on point. All of our dishes was made just right with Frutti De Mari prepared to our expectations. This was the favorite among the dishes we had including my lasagna order. Layered with equal amounts of meat and cheese and was cooked well without being overcooked and runny. Onto to the desserts, the family got 3 different items: Lemon Ricatta Cheesecake, Tiramisu and Cannoli. The Cannoli was a hit with our party because it was fresh and had a balanced sweetness an airy crisp texture. Will need to come back! Overall we had wonderful time for my parents Anniversary. Special shoutout to the staff, "Grazie Mille!" :)  2018 Yelp Review #40

JuKbKEDFUUMyPqjkZyz58g.text: So this has a deli attached which serves everything spot on and would get 5 stars. The restaurant on the other hand gets 2 stars. The service is great. The menu seems very confused. They pair items with dishes that don't belong togather. We ordered a very simple cheese ravioli it was served floating in butter which at first I thought was water. I thought they had boiled the ravioli and didn't shake it off so I asked the waiter. He explained its a butter sage. Hence why there were 3 pieces of fried sage on my ravioli. I honestly coulda poured the butter out into a small ramekin and dipped some lobster in it. Sage doesn't belong anywhere near marinara. I'm not a chef but it over powers everything.  Wife ordered the flavorless bolognese might as well have been hamburger helper. The chef here is very confused. Italian is simple flavors epic fail. Deli is 5 stars great everything.

s98XQA6WzXJmPkScXd9kVw.text: We really like the takeout side.  You can buy Italian imports to take home and make your own meals.   I only buy my Parmesan cheese here---it's imported and just delicious.    Recommend the meatball sub too. Delicious fresh buffalo mozzarella too.   The reason for 4 vs 5 stars is that I've eaten in the fine dining section once and it was average.    But the other side for takeouts is super!

jbC1lQSg5rexmxqYyEMA3w.text: This is a great spot to have a cup of coffee and some fresh italian bread which is baked daily and ready by around 9 am.  The staff is friendly and accommodating.  I had red pepper egg frittata on a baguette and it was amazing.  They have a variety of options from sandwiches, pasta dishes to desserts. Bonus: they have a military discount.

I0hvLvT1fewBkBfHje_lCg.text: If you are looking for a real italian deli look no further.  The sandwiches are built to order and the sandwich bread they use is amazing. The marinated mushrooms in the deli section are some of my favorites and they also have pre-made meatballs that you can take home along with some pre-made marinara sauce and bolognese.  They deli is attached to a small italian grocery section for all the canned and boxed favorites.  Highly recommend!

Q6OA_VBjrprvjvijezU9KA.text: The ambiance is nice, good for large parties or intimate gathering. Our server Dima was excellent, she was accommodating to my dietary restrictions. The bread basket came with garlic butter which was surprisingly delicious. The garlic was not over powering. We only had one issue with the soup of the day but they kindly took it off our bill and added in a free dessert. So overall I'd give that a 4/5. I had one of the best penne ala vodka dishes. The prices are reasonable for the portion. I would like to come back and try their rigatoni dish.

oQN7eNOYJRHq-nxnP467tw.text: I really enjoyed dinner at Siena. Haven't been in a couple years - but before the name change, I recall coming to Bartoloni's and liking that, too. Siena has a welcoming environment, not too loud, but still lively. The service, I thought, was excellent. Our server was Italian, and I found him to be helpful and gracious, possessing a gentle but wry sense of humor.  The app for the table was a big winner - and a surprise. When you order Calamari, in general, it seems like you're simply trying to please everyone at once - and usually at the expense of something great. Yay to Siena for dispelling that prejudice of mine. The dish was tasty, not greasy, and man, there was an ample amount for several nibblers. I also liked the tomato based sauce - which was a tad spicy.  My glass of white wine was refreshing. The second glass was even better (and seemed a bit larger, lol). It was recommended to me by our server - after I shared my tastes with him. Bullseye. Delish.  The entree was a special: Black Ink Pasta (Sciue Sciue) with shrimp and scallops. Though the red sauce also had some bite to it - it was very different from say, an arrabiata. (And yes, different from the dipping sauce from our appetizer). The Sciue Sciue was hearty, flavorful and I really liked it. Might be nit picking, but i wish there were just a tad more of the accompanying seafood. But, still a good dish that I'd definitely recommend.  I look forward to coming back sometime soon. And someday, coming by their retail store to pick up some pastas, sauces, and more.

photos.caption: Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scuie Scuie Black Ink Pasta with Shrimp and Scallops
Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi in pesto

p_24pP902Mohb3NYc_MntA.text: We were out in Summerlin for biz, and we happened to stop by Siena in a strip mall.  Its on Sahara near Fort Apache.  I started off w/ a small ruchetta salad w/ arugula & figs ($6).  For my main, I had an ortolana pizza w/ eggplant & asparagus ($14).  Siena offers a lot of sandwiches, salads, pastas and pizzas.  In addition, they have a deli adjacent to the restaurant.  First of all, the salad was very good.  You don't often see figs in a salad, and the sweetness contrasted well against the peppery taste of the arugula:  4 Stars.  On the other hand, the pizza was just OK.  The toppings were tasty, but the crust lacked any character.  In addition, the toppings weren't evenly distributed, and there wasn't enough to cover each slice:  3 Stars.   Our waiter Tracy was very good.  He was friendly, attentive and on top of things.  Any special requests were filled quickly:  4 Stars.  Likewise, the ambiance is nice.  There is a large bar area to your left as you enter.  The main dining room is straight ahead, and the deli is to the right.  A nice feature in the dining room is a large wine display separating it from the deli:  4 Stars.  If you find yourself in the area, bag the rec for Nacho Daddy across the small side street.  Siena has very good food at reasonable prices, and the service & ambiance to match.  Plus 7% cash back w/ Yelp checkin and your credit card linked to your account.

WbbtBXqkUfsEL0pU7IuqkQ.text: This is the most under rated Italian Restaurant in Las Vegas.  If I could give it 7 Stars, it'd be worth it.  Their seafood pasta & bread pudding is out of this world.  The prices are extremely reasonable for the portions & quality you receive.  The staff makes you feel like royalty.  Can't wait for our next visit.

It looks us 20 min to eat and another 30 min for the check. We asked them to bring the check to us  and we still waited another 18 min upon that.
