p1gMsgJ8c5kv072ZeUBV0A.text: Absolutely amazing restaurant and delicious Italian food.  The veal piccata is one of the most amazing dishes I've ever had and was tremendously flavorful with a great portion size.  Our service was excellent and my wife and I got to speak to one of the lead chefs, Oscar, who put together our dishes and also prepared an amazing dessert for us for our romantic night out.  We definitely plan to come back for future romantic nights out as well as to try their deli.  A major gem in west Vegas and tremendous taste, service and value for fine Italian dining.

6UzS_nneJuMhnsmPyDhx7Q.text: We decided to have our son's wedding rehearsal dinner here. Giancarlo was very helpful and helped to make the dinner a success. Food was delicious and everyone enjoyed it. It was on their patio and it was just as beautiful as we had hoped for. Will definitely be back for dinner. The entertainment was great! And would highly recommend for your next event! Thank you Giancarlo and staff!

mpq9wl4R7ai7NEpgv3gytw.text: We came in to Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria starving so when we were welcomed with a bread basket honestly I couldn't wait to dig in. The dip that they served with this bread was so good! I think it was made with black olives (which I'm not usually a fan of) . The dip doesn't look appetizing but looks can be deceiving.  I don't know what else was in this dip but I couldn't stop eating it. I asked for seconds and on a side note the following week I made a special trip to their deli next door and bought more of it!  I also had some minestrone soup while I was waiting for my entree. The soup was delicious with the fresh grated cheese on top of it. We also had the bruschetta to share. The ingredients were fresh and tasty. I tried their special which was a seafood pasta in a cream sauce. It was good but I really just wanted more bread and dip!  We ended the meal with their dessert sampler which are regular sized desserts. When we asked the waiter what the choices were he said basically it is whatever they have left over. Our dessert platter came with canolis, cheese cake, tiramisu, and a chocolate mousse. They were so good!   The restaurant and the deli have a nice ambience. The service was awesome! The waiter is the one who told me that they sell the dip in their deli so he was up there in my book.  I want to go back sooner than later and try more of their menu!

xf1-Dhewnw8YjrHFLdDBsA.text: Sfogliatella, Italian pastry perfection!  You know you have a VERY good friend when they share snacks like this with YOU!  Especially when these beautiful tasty morsels are no where to be found within 2,500 miles.  My girlfriend from Naples LOVES these treats...but she is so loving and giving that she shared the only one in her possession, (which her most wonderful husband hauled all the way back from California) with me. We sat there and split it, did not speak as we licked our fingers until every crumb was gone.  We just stared at our empty plates with despair.  Knowing we would never be able to eat this again for months, maybe years to come.  We started planning a trip to Italy, which can't come soon enough!  I don't usually get a sweet unless I can share it.  If I have to choose between dessert and a glass of wine when it comes to calories, wine usually wins.  But this treat is not too sweet, it's just simply amazing.  Fast forward to this morning...Siena, half restaurant, half bakery/deli, in Summerlin. We arrive mid morning to find the case empty!  OMG, shouldn't have stayed out so late last night, we missed it!!!  Why couldn't we get here earlier?!  So many reasons, too many to count...at any rate sadness turns into happiness as soon as I explain my despair to Fabio.  He tells me wait 30 minutes, he will bake more! Really?!?! Of course we will wait.  I'd wait all day for this amazing creation.   Walking around their take out gourmet food section could easily take half an hour!  Salami, cheese, prosciutto sampling cut to perfection.  The couple at the table next to us, from Milan, happily sharing their pistachio mortadella and piping hot baguette with us!Exactly 30 minutes later...voila! Fabio returns with lattes,  cappuccino's and 4 piping hot sfogliatella's!!!  6 more made to bake at home to go! All magically appeared and disappeared all within one hour of being in this authentic Italian bakery/deli.  I have to pinch myself to see if I was dreaming.  This pastry was done to perfection!  Not sweet, cream filled, flaky, hot, crispy and ooohh soooo gooood with the strong Italian espresso.  Just what we needed.  If only I could only learn to make these little wonders at home.  I ask Fabio to explain...his hands fly up in the air!  Much too difficult!

_G7vc5b-7soGqkGGDC_46A.text: This is our go to when it comes to anything Italian. When I need to pick up nice cold cuts from the deli, Siena is my go to. When we want a nice meal out with the family this is also our go to. The Burrata is so light and refreshing, a great appetizer. I also love the mussles in a spicy red sauce. Top it off with the Veal Piccata you have perfection. We've also sat in the bar, had a nice glass of wine and some appetizers. The majority of the employee's have been there a while, that makes it a nice place to pop into with familiar faces. Great locals spot.

rfzlZz4uYhWD6aQIy5qvEw.text: Good hoagies, good selection of Italian stuff not easily accessible in LV.  Staff is OK, not the friendliest not mean either.  I will continue to go back.  They basically charge extra for everything you add to a hoagie that they don't put on themselves.

sddF52ow4sxqB1ACUKH7gw.text: I like this place. I havent been here in a long while, but it is easy to get to especially if you live in Summerlin. They have a great happy hour, and the food is good. Sinatra plays in the background and it feels like little Italy. But don't think for a minute that this is trendy place for that go elsewhere.    The bar is lined with old lonely men who have come here to reminisce of days long gone. Most of the patrons look and dress like they belong in retirement communities in Florida or Sun City.   The atmosphere is nice, people are pleasant...and the staff is great.

_bNQMO2nPgcGX63B4gKqxw.text: The Deli on the side of the Italian restaurant is quaint and resemble an authentic Italian deli. The cold cut sandwiches are excellent and the orzo and chicken soup was right on the money. No frills here, just good authentic Italian meats and cheeses that make the sandwiches out of this world. A must try.

Hlgp9VQQQNk2KvdzZrIVrQ.text: Best Happy Hour food in the city plus live music at times. I am there for lunch a few times a week in the private room. They have a big heart, great food and the most amazing deli.

Isb3gp3CoxUHe8_5AO06iQ.text: We were out shopping and decided to stop in for dinner. Not realizing we needed a reservation, we were seated after a ten minute wait. Not the greatest table, close to the kitchen, but the food and service made up for it. The food is excellent and there are so many wonderful choices. We will be returning again, but this time with a reservation.

hbhBh2wtRcLNzR-vXLco7Q.text: Amazing service! Alex and Todd are both excellent and Gian Carlo, the on site owner really cares about his restaurant. I stopped by tonight and heard Jack Walker singing, it added to the already awesome food and ambiance. Would highly recommend! Date night, girls night out, whatever - it's a should be on your must-try list!

o_ca73NkZL7A58sBgqwqgQ.text: Excellent Food , Drink and Amazing Music . This evening had StefnRock added an incredible mood with thier music . Great Service and Atmosphere .

jO0KvAESuX1Ux_h-twjbqw.text: I love this restaurant the staff is always wonderful the food is good most of the time every now and then you get really mushy pasta they have to remember to keep it al dente. Delicious wine selection and Wednesday nights they have an 80s cover band that is really fun and not too loud so you can enjoy the company of your family as well as music. The penne vodka is out of this world

cUZ4M8bBbye2PvxIVzpwfA.text: Came to eat at Siena tonight and I was blown away with how nice this restaurant is . They have an amazing relaxing lounge area with a very reasonable happy hour . The foot tasted amazing and I could tell everything was fresh . But over all the best thing about my experience was the service . My server LiLi was the icing on the cake . She was super friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu . Thanks for an unforgettable experience LiLi . I'll definitely be recommending this place to friend !

7QzdzSYyuk2_Xv6mljpWRg.text: Unbelievably delicious. Home made pasta and sauce. Good service, atmosphere, good entertainment. A+ I recommend to many friends and look forward to going back.

CnI_okdQPX-j2wwyJmPBZQ.text: The Sicilian hoagie is worth the extra effort to enjoy lunch at Siena. I never pass up the fresh and delicious sandwich.

ZZhw3FZQfedS7HoSin9QWQ.text: We had some of the best service here than we have had in a very long time.   This place is great for us because it is right across the street. We ordered a calzone, cheese ravioli, and a spicy sausage pasta. All of them, were excellent. The calzone was light and fluffy so it didn't weigh you down much. The ravioli had crispy sage and brown butter. And the sausage pasta was spicy, and a good sized portion. With two glasses of wine, and dessert, our bill for three people was $80. A bit on the higher end but it was nothing considering the flavor and service. We will definitely be back.

t-h2k7nbCCScoTYGuqjSuQ.text: Amazing food, the best waiter and an all around great atmosphere. This will be a regular place for us now.

C85b6NEtzjrUYkImXO_cqA.text: Review of the Deli portion of the location.  I've been frequenting this deli as time goes by. As an East Coast transplant, this place really makes me homesick, by nourishing that part of me which misses all the little Italian delis and bakeries I would find back home. From the assorted bread, to the fresh pasta, the snacks and the hard to find antipasti. The prices are definitely high - you're in a desert oasis and they've imported most stuff from ITALY. So, I splurge here because it's worth it. And if we go often enough maybe the prices will go down.   My absolute must-haves: biscuits (aka biscotti), pasta (dried, best prices!), cheese (marscapone best price anywhere!), torrone, pizza (literally the best in Summerlin). They even carry great cooking tools like paellas (the pan used for making paella), pasta machines, ravioli cutters, etc.   When I came upon this place I nearly fainted. I wish the deli would triple in size! My hopes for the future: create a wine section, maybe some on tap, have a bigger pastry selection. All-in-all, love this place and it feels like a hidden gem.

haXWjwWpxrM5h_JnxKuaNA.text: The cannolis are very disappointing. I expected better from an Italian restaurant / deli.  Feb. 2016 cannoli update: Sadly, I must report that Siena's cannoli are still disappointing. The gal making the cannoli used a huge bag of filling which I suspect comes from an Italian food supply company. Still searching for better cannolis.

Sa0qey3Y0cWQfAUz3kx5UQ.text: Review is specifically for happy hour:       Good happy hour, food is very good and drinks are reasonable especially considering the quality of the place, the owners are usually there and are from Italy. The crowd that goes there are very nice. Recommended!!!  My last review I complained about the service but on a return visit, I believe the problem has been corrected ....

Glh8__bkFkC4OPA2pDvnUA.text: Wow! I'm really impressed with the happy hour. Okay prices, slowish "Euro" style service, but this place literally has about a 70% Italian staff.   The food was tasty, the drinks were good, the ambiance was amazing. I'll be back!

KAs7SPUB-Pn_EzAQvQjiEA.text: I made reservations for Valentine's Day two weeks in advance, when we showed up they said our table was taken and that a couple had been sitting in there for two hours and refused to leave which we found out was not necessarily the case. The lady at the reservation desk was rude about it until I told her that my husband was home from deployment and had not seen him in five months.  While I understand Valentine's Day can be very crowded but with proper planning their restaurant would not have been such chaos. When the waiter came and took her order I specifically told him a New York steak medium rare, he delivered a cold Gristle laden rub eye that was 75% fat the hors d'oeuvres were cold and not fully cooked and my husband and I ended up taking a few bites leaving the restaurant still hungry. I seriously would not recommend this restaurant to anyone!

rXv7uB-L9mo_vEnKm8Lm3g.text: Great selection of meat and Italian products here.   If you're ever in the mood for a mortadella sandwich, this is a great place to go, and it's also in the same block as Settebello, an authentic pizzeria (VPN).  We get our deli meats here regularly and would recommend it to anyone looking for genuine Italian fare.

TupLt16wQEXSglEewNyXEg.text: I JUST LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! So far I have done happy hour and lunch and both visits were 5 star! The dining room is elegant with beautifully decorated wine wall. They have a deli where you can buy fresh baked bread, desserts, pasta and almost everything that you enjoyed in the dining room!  Happy hour is in the lounge from 3-7 pm Mon-Saturday and ALL DAY ON SUNDAY!! Yes you heard me right! Lots of delicious food options, and wine is 40% off by the glass. They have lunch specials but I ordered from the regular menu coz I am a sucker for gnocchi. Their pesto cream gnocchi is to die for.. tender, melt in your mouth and they are so generous with their delicious sauce. Complimentary bread basked has warm fresh baked bread with olive tapenade. Dessert selection is huge, I tried cassata cake which was good but a little dry. Cannolis are delicious!

uvJNHpnsCA3JbdBR1UFkiA.text: Walking in was confusing cause of the two different sides of the building with the deli shop and the restaurant but it got figured out. I was automatically iffy about how the staff was the second I got in there.  The entire menu is extremely overpriced. I was so confused on why it was so pricey but assumed it was just because the food must be that good to where it would make sense. First thing was the drinks which the soda was very flat and also 3.00 which is crazy for just a soft drink. The bread came after and it was pretty good but the only good part about the whole thing. After ordering, it took about 30 minutes to get our food and again, I assumed it was because it was good food and just took time to make...  When getting the food I got way too excited and just got disappointed being that both me and the person I was with weren't happy with how it came out and what we were expecting. It was super dry and chewy and didn't have much flavor.  Also to add onto the rest of our experience with the staff, we were uncomfortable the entire time because they were giving us dirty looks and staring and even would stare at us while talking making it obvious that they were speaking about us.  For the price, how the staff was, and how the food was, I definitely will not be returning and will not recommend it to anyone. Could've gotten cheaper food for way better and with better customer service.

EB_b_wnK9QcttSklKpB1EA.text: I've had my eye on the deli side of this restaurant for awhile. After getting newborn photos around the corner we came in for lunch. Overall, our food and experience was okay.  The deli and store offers a large selection of hot and cold Italian food to take to go or enjoy on site. They also have a large case of Italian desserts and cookies. The market has fun items for Italian cooking.  I went with an Eggplant Parmesan Sub for my lunch.  My husband had the Chicken Parmesan Sub. We both thought the subs were okay. There wasn't anything special about either sub like an awesome red sauce or special bread. The Italian Cassata Cake was also okay, but again nothing special.  The Italian cookies looked delicious and I was excited to get an assortment to take home. None of these were great and some lacked any flavor. I threw most away because the lactation cookies my doula baked for me were much tastier.   Positives were the outdoor patio seating and that the food came out quickly.

Still was charged for sandwich, when I explained that the food wasn't as it was written on the menu they didn't refund me, but merely gave me a handwritten slip of paper and said come back and we'll take care of you next time. What a joke.

zyfk73YfYloWo0EiH-vv1g.text: Must try their deli! Fresh Italian cookies, imported Italian salami, Italian ham and much more  Their sandwich are so good and I enjoy their homemade salads like the cucumber / tomato, the calamari salad to go

XhKWFhp0Hlc0KF8zQXN5jQ.text: Nice Market and Deli  This place reminds me of Molinari's in North Beach, San Francisco. Friendly service. Deli meats sliced to order. Italian staples out the gazoo.

WZ1UJNcv1mUTH6d9YQkrvw.text: Friday, August 24 2018  4:45 PM  Originally we came in for deli sandwiches to order as takeout.  We browsed their little shop shelves they had a lot of authentic pastas in the box and it was surprisingly reasonable for it traveling so far (east coast I assume) to get there.   Some of the stuff I remember from my childhood like the blue and yellow box of pasta my grandparents used being Portuguese.  I ordered the cold Italian sandwich (back in RI we call them grinders).  It was very good for the $5.49 and the bread was so delicious!  My boyfriend had the eggplant Parmesan because it's his favorite as he's Italian.  It was maybe a 10 minute wait which wasn't long at all for the hour it was, guess we caught them before the dinner rush.  Their bakery and deli has amazing dessert on display!  Wow, they only thing I was sad about they didn't have semi sweet cannoli I guess that's an American thing?  But they sold the shells if you want to make them at home!

iEUh_13_3HHptPvtK5YJ9w.text: Really enjoy the fantastic service here. I've had the sliders which were great, the bruschetta was four massive helpings, a minimum two mouthful for me. crzcLH73D-D6yW6B3L0mOw.text: The food here was very disappointing. I wouldn't describe anything as bad necessarily, but it was all very very mediocre. I ate with my girlfriend and each of our moms, and we all shared calamari, chicken parmigiana, lasagna, a calzone, and linguini alfredo.  I don't like calimari, but my girlfriend and her mom both love it. They usually can't get enough of it, but this time they left about 20% of it. I saw some left and said, "you guys don't want to finish the calimari?" and they just kinda shrugged.  Also, the bread. It was kinda hard and crunchy. I'm a big bread person and I really didn't like it. It didn't come with butter or olive oil, which I thought was weird, just this odd green spread that I've never seen before.  The calzone was the best part of the meal, and I'd just describe it as fine. It was nice and warm, but I thought it was too thin and bread-y, and the red sauce was just very mediocre. Plus they barely gave us any red sauce, but they did happily give us more after I requested it.  I love chicken parm and I thought it was definitely below average here at Sienna. The chicken itself didn't have a nice fried crispiness on the outside and overall tasted pretty bland. I love when chicken parm comes with nice fresh mozzarella on top, bu my the mozzarella wasn't fresh tasting or flavorful. Same with the red sauce. It came over a bed of pasta. It was dry pasta, not fresh. And it could have been cooked a bit more al dente. It was fine, but not what you'd want from a nice Italian restaurant.  The lasagna was worse than the chicken parm. They pasta was on the mushy side. And like everything else just wasn't very fresh or flavorful.  And the alfredo was even worse than the lasagna. I'd definitely describe it as "bad". The pasta was weird, it was kinda mushy and stuck together. I've screwed up pasta like this at home before. It happens when you don't stir it and it sticks together and gets mushy. The Alfredo sauce itself was just not fresh or flavorful. It came with ham. I would have preferred the ham to be at least slightly browned on the outside. It tastes so much better that way. There was no browning or crispiness. And the dish really needed some sort of lightness to complement the creaminess. I think sweet green peas are great with it, but at least some parsley would have been better than nothing. For visual reasons too, i forgot to take pictures, but the color was just the white sauce and some pink from the ham. Some green sprinkled in would have made it "pop", both visually and taste-wise.  For desert we got a flourless chocolate cake, and tiramisu. I'm not a tiramisu person so I'm not sure how to judge it, but I didn't care for it. The flourless chocolate cake was really weird. It was like a mix of cake and frosting, but somehow also tasted dry. Idk how to describe it.  Aside from the food, everything was great. The decor was really nice, and the service was good. But food is what ultimately matters, and the food was very disappointing. I really wouldn't recommend Sienna.

UgG0oQT8N95ie0MR_smIpg.text: Came here last night for our office holiday party. This was our first year in the past 3 years we decided to give a different restaurant a shot and I am pretty disappointed because we all really wanted to like this place more than we did as it was much more expensive per person and no open bar.  -The service was decent -The amount of food was so small! One table only had 4 people at it so they got lucky and were able to eat enough to feel full--but the rest of the tables had 5 or 6 people and they brought out family style plates of everything that was very small portions for the amount of people at those tables, so they were left feeling very hungry and had to go out to eat again afterwards. -They took away our plates and forks without asking if we were finished eating, so my boyfriend had to eat with a serving spoon because he was still hungry...but h eventually gave up because that's awkward and made him feel uncomfortable haha. -Same thing happened with the desserts. There were 4 pieces of different desserts brought out to a table of up to 6, so it was kind of difficult to share and awkward to share since it isn't like this was a family party! It's a work party with significant others who are not familiar with people at their table! -The food itself was decent, but nothing stood out to me personally... but I didn't get a chance to try the chicken and mushroom dish (not enough food) and people said that was good. The cheesecake dessert was good though.  Overall, the major disappointment was the food for the price. The family style serving was awkward, but I would have felt better about it if they at least gave bigger portions of food.  Many of us were left feeling hungry...However, the food was decent and the service was okay. The restaurant itself looked really nice too. I think coming here for a normal meal would be good though!

photos.caption: Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the plate of 4 small pieces of dessert--kinda hard to share.

Y8jXVeHDK0pD72mj61VeNg.text: Maybe because we had a larger party so tip is automatically included but our waitress wasn't super attentive to us. She was nice but maybe too busy to serve a larger group?  I had to flag her down a couple of times for water. We went for happy hour and our bill was also calculated wrong.   The food for happy hour was actually pretty good. I loved the calamari and the lamb chops. The lamb chops weren't gamey at all and both portion sizes were great.   Definitely the best out of the dishes we tried. The bruschetta was delicious, crab cakes were ok. A little over fried and not enough crab flavor.   The shrimp scampi needed some more garlic in my opinion but the shrimps were big and juicy.   Their cheese pizza is also not bad as well. The sauce is a little on the sweeter side though.   I would come here for happy hour again. The food was not bad but don't expect a great culinary experience.

KoeKGa64rk0TnGyJAre0SA.text: 2 stars!  One star for bread and one star for the butter (prepackaged in the little foil wrapper).  Ok wait...that's really only 1 star deserved.   It literally stuns me that people choose to eat here when there are dozens of amazing Italian restaurants within a 5 or 10 mile radius (Roma deli, chef Marc's...)   We had the lasagna and the fettuccini. Pretty basic right?  $17.95 each...which is way overpriced...for the tiny portions and tasteless food we were served.   The fettuccini literally smelled of flour and was so tasteless...it was mind boggling. I never add salt to my food...EVER, but this plate of pasta had me double fisting BOTH the salt and pepper shakers.   My husband at the lasagna...he didn't say it was good or bad...but he did say "we don't need to eat here again."   The bread was good. Maybe it was just relativity. I'm not sure.   Needless to say, I won't be back.    I feel very bamboozled by all of you who park your car out front and eat here...I assumed that a busy restaurant (from what I saw) meant delicious food. I was wrong and am hugely disappointed with my experience.

ajK9axX0Uz1_FYBwO_kSFw.text: I Love Everything Here! Just recently I had 3 appetizers and a dessert and I swear it was so delicious it made my day sooo much better! Thank you for the excellent service and too notch quality REAL Food!!

8VOggu8c8xapXxvgsioqAA.text: We dined there 7/20/2017.  It took between 10 and 15 minutes for them to come to us after we were seated.  No water or bread for 10-15 minutes.  Don't know why, because they were not too busy and it was at 7pm.  The food portions are small, but the food was good.  I never got a refill for my water glass, even though it sat empty the entire time after the initial pour.  Although I did not ask for a refill as I am pretty passive.  The lasagna was super hot on one side, and just luke warm in the middle.  I don't complain much, so It was ok.  I live close by and will try them again and update my review.

8ELnqrpP_NlrpAwOKCmYXQ.text: We had a great waiter named Ante, from Croatia. Bread basket with Tapenade was very good. Ordered calamari as appetizer it was hot and crispy, the way we like it,also a very generous portion. Wife had a vegetable strudel and I had fettuccine with meat balls and meat sauce. Could not finish it all, but will eat meatballs for lunch.

EhI5snC0JLaH1PClUtQWYA.text: By far my favorite Italian restaurant. It is a bit pricy but every meal is always in point. The portion size is good too. They always take good care of you.

TaUuBuAL6pZcZ6rfDbYhvQ.text: This review is for the deli.  I had been wanting to try this place and was surprised to find out they have a deli and restaurant! From the front of the building, the deli is on the right and the restaurant is on the left.   I ordered a "Sicilian Sandwich" priced at $6.99 and a "Meatball Parmigiana Sandwich" also priced at $6.99 for hubby since he was lost looking at the bread loaves they had for sale. The girl behind the counter gave me a receipt and said I needed to pay the girl at the front. Heading towards the front I noticed some yummy looking desserts and decided to get a slice of "Pecan Cheesecake" priced at $4 per slice. Hubby picked out a focaccia loaf that cost $1.90 and we were set.   The Sicilian sandwich was really good! It didn't look like there was much to it, but it packed a lot of flavor. Half way through our sandwiches, hubby and I decided to switch and the meatball sandwich was cheesy, delicious and something I would order again, but I liked mine better. I had the pecan cheesecake later for dessert and it was much better than other places around put out. The focaccia loaf however wasn't fresh. To be fair, we did come in just after 8 pm, so the bread was maybe baked earlier in the day, but they should mark the baked goods down after a certain point. I enjoyed the sandwiches and dessert enough to return!   Inside was clean and the employees were very friendly and helpful.

o69bquXnAyUAMcdcZSG1fw.text: I had no idea they had a nicer resaurant side and a deli & bakery on another. Now that I do, I will be stopping in more for lunch. I always see the parking lot packed with cars when driving by so my wife and I decided to check it out.   The deli & bakery side has glass cases of breads, cakes, cookies etc. I originally wanted a sausage sandwich (the sausage is made fresh at the restaurant) but they were out for the day so we ordered a meatball and Sicilian sandwich. Both were good and affordable. The meatball sandwich was cheesy and the sauce had a good taste. I don't know how many meatballs are supposed to come on it but they weren't shy with them at all. The Sicilian sandwich had a lot of flavor for not looking like much. There was either an Italian dressing or maybe oil and vinegar on it but whatever it was I liked it. The bread on the sandwiches was good but I picked out a loaf of bread from the bakery and it wasn't as soft and fresh tasting as I hoped for. I will pick out a different kind next time and give it a try. Good to know there is another solid sandwich in town.

WwZXm_l12rBb70JCYzPHkw.text: Nieve Malandra sings in the bar area of Siena on Friday night from 8:00-11:00. She is gorgeous and a very, very good singer. She helps establish a terrific atmosphere in the restaurant. The food is very good. Josh and the rest of the staff are very friendly and accommodating. Siena is located at 9500 West Sahara (near Fort Apache and Sahara). If you are looking for a laid back atmosphere with great food, do yourself a favor and check out Siena on Friday evening.

hUFJpDGG2CbasiOXEgA6Ow.text: It's my birthday and we were out for dinner.  Were should we go?  We decided to try something new and this was our choice.  We have passed by many times, but never really noticed this place.  So walking in, we were surprised by the deli.  The display cases full of sweets and other treats including wonderful sausages and fresh made pastas.   They also serve cooked items, for a take home meal.  And of course there are loaded shelves with various grocery items.  After a lingering walk through, we made into an almost empty restaurant.  I think we may have been the second table.  It was early evening but I was still a bit concern with no dinner crowd.  Our server came right away and we made a couple of appetizer selections.  I tried the polenta sauteed porcini.  Loaded with mushrooms and assorted seafood on top of grilled polenta.   It was very savory good. They had just cooked off some homemade sausages and brought us a "wheel" gratis.  I love sausage, so this was a wonderful addition to the meal.  For my entree I got the "zuppa reale" which is a bouillabaisse with seafood, in fish broth and chopped tomatoes.   It was a bit spicy and very good especially with the assortment of breads to soak up the broth.    The server and the assistants were quick on service, kept our tea glasses full and promptly removed our empty plates.  We admit that it was really good meal, and we do want to return soon.    One of the menu items that might entice us to come again, is the high protein meal, called Misto Carne Alla Griglia, marinated grilled homemade sausages, pork ribs, chicken and steak.  When we are low "carbing", this would make a great meal!

c1uRhRznw_tC0u-AYIgbfw.text: This place has the best pesto gnocchi I've ever had, for a very reasonable price. Both the pesto and gnocchi are homemade there! I recently went to another Italian place with the same dish that was twice as much and not as good. I'll be coming back just for this dish!

ukB9rvwvQCY2nqx5YIfYyQ.text: Solid Italian food...good, just not great.  The atmosphere is nice, and they had live music playing in the background on this Sunday afternoon.  Started off with the Formaggiere ($12.75): Carboncino, Pecorino Pepato, Fontina, and Fontinella cheeses. They were all pretty good, and the portions were fair since we had about 3-4 pieces of each.  Also tried the Gnocchi al Pesto ($13.75): Homemade Potato & Ricotta Dumpling in Pesto. This was pretty good! A little more starchy than I've had, but the pesto sauce was fantastic.  This was the highlight of meal for me.  Lasagna ($13.75): Meat Sauce, Ricotta, Parmesan, & Mozzarella Cheese. This was good overall, but the inside was a little cooler than the rest.  The hot parts weren't very mentionable either...I'd skip this one personally.    Overall, I don't think you can go WRONG...it's just difficult when I compare it to my other favorites in Vegas. gcZSHKbSBw3lqnQq5BgZFQ.text: This is consider one of the worst restaurant. The service was bad, food took forever to be ready, and the portions was small. I will not go back again.

WAN_zS4fy66XIVB8wvRSUA.text: I recently moved to Las Vegas and had a truly delightful experience at Siena Italian restaurant yesterday, one which I am still contemplating. For some time now I have had a deep feeling of sorrow of times past when one could go to a restaurant and have a REAL meal and enjoy a feeling of authenticity with both the food and with who is serving you. An authentic Italian meal where the meats are processed on the premise, the pastas and breads are made fresh and the server, a True Italian gentleman, explained the meals and offered to change whatever I may not like.   I loved everything. The food was real food, prepared like it has always been done for generations. The atmosphere reminded me of my childhood when my family would go to a nice restaurant. It was a privilege to dine out and we would dressed up, always on our best behavior. I remember then the linen table clothes and the servers attention to detail. The fresh dinner rolls and so on. This place has the same ambiance.   This place, it is not just a restaurant, but a place out of time to give you the gift of memories, whether the atmosphere triggers it or the food itself...this place made me feel at home for the first time since I moved here. It made wish that I was Italian for just a bit.:) I had remarked to my husband that I couldn't remember the last time that a meal made me this happy, where you moan with delight...certainly the Torta Lunga did that for both us!   This is the place to bring your friends and family too. I am also delighted to read that they also have bands that play on certain days in both the mid morning and evening.  After our lovely dinner we browsed the deli area and felt so blessed to have this deli/ restaurant down the street from where we live.   Thanks to Pasquale for a wonderful experience. Deborah

JLCKSJzwTxcBfsLJ50rWvA.text: Awesome place with a great Happy Hour!  Older crowd and great prices!!!!  Service is top notch and the bartenders are excellent! One of my favorite spots!!!

qNqy6P5-e8Hur8vQzwjGmQ.text: This was my third happy hour visit. I love the atmosphere and the menu choices. I encouraged the ladies to come here for a birthday and was a bit disappointed. The service was slow this time which hampered the evening. I encouraged ordering the lamb chops since we enjoyed them on another visit. This time they lacked flavor. The happy hour salad was okay but was drenched in dressing. We appreciated the birthday girl's free tiramisu but why didn't the waitress tell us when the birthday girl ordered the cannoli's? My friend was disappointed in the crab cakes. It was not an ideal visit. I will consider returning since other visits were enjoyable.

UFemBc-67AzPvVpKTjxqWw.text: Had a party of 18 yesterday celebrating my best friend's birthday. Nice atmosphere inside, GM/Owner seated us then checked on us later that night to see how things were going. Served the kids first then the adults which was nice since they were getting antsy. Food was delicious. Only minor complaint was it wasn't very busy and service was on the slow side; however, no one botched up orders, brought us anything we had asked for and always remained courteous. Thank you. Id love to try something new next time!

3hmEhLMiHEo7-aKwxclAhA.text: Second time here. The crab cakes were great. Some of the best I've ever had. The pizza was okay nothing special. The calamari was good. Crispy and fresh. The lamb chops were delicious and much better than I expected. The bruschetta was subpar. Don't order it. The antipasti was enjoyable.

cOkco-dNSExItTVR2dgTpQ.text: Gotta say, I wasn't to please with this place.   Annoyances:  Waitress went to seat us [since there was a non existent host] I said booth please (they had one waiting to be cleaned). She rolled her eyes and said well it's going to take 5 minutes or so, I said, " That is fine, I can wait."  She wasn't pleased.   Lucky me she really was our waitress. *eye roll*. She rushed everything, [wasn't that busy, might have had (4)4-tops that were being used as deuces, save one that happened to be an actual 4 people.  Then I asked if the calamari had tentacles in it, said I didn't want it if it didn't, she said yes, plenty. Out it comes with 1. I'm not kidding 1. What in the name of calamari is that, you said plenty!   Then she seemed upset we asked for wine and then more bread. I asked for more bread because the calamari sauce was bland, the lasagna I ordered lacked flavor as well (next day it tasted a bit better in microwave) and well, her crappy attitude was making me lose my appetite.   I tipped her 15% because I can't go less and told myself I will come back another day and see if it's any better!

S6-K-RM9X97afY2fYhTTaA.text: Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli is one of the best places that you can dine locally in Vegas without having to visit all of the Hotels. They have a great location near the heart of Summerlin. Their authentic dishes are outstanding as well as the prompt service that their staff's provide. Thank you so much for creating this wonderful dining venue Chef Giancarlo Bomparola!!! ()

ZIrjwqau8bqBFM3hB8Z2Wg.text: Really good Deli For italia. Lovers! Restaurant is great too and if you need catering service JAkie is always helping out! Good place to hang out!

_HVDrREWq1ShkMqv8ysPGg.text: Great neighborhood Italian place. I always get the Cavatelli Con Salsiccia. Always great service and love the assortment bread they bring out.

6MS0m5j-pZe5XcJ6h9sBRQ.text: We ate at the deli.  Their eggplant Parmesan sandwich was delicious, but only contained one thin layer of eggplant (perhaps one quarter of 1 inch thick).  For the price, it was poor value although quite tasty.

n_vaNgaVB0B-XeMHkrDqpA.text: For 25 years since I've lived in Las Vegas I always went to Siena Deli on Trop & Eastern for the "Best Fresh Hot Italian Sausage" and finally I get the chance to get over to the fancy new location on West Sahara to get out fix.  The Siena deli is now by far much more organized, lavished and beautiful.  However, their sausage is now a whopping $7 bucks a pound (it use to be $4-5 per pound)........but no biggie, everything has gone up.  I was so excited to taste it, so I get home, my hubby makes his sauce opens up the bag to add the sausage and first thing I notice is the sausage has no color (hot is usually red from the pepper and spice) and just by the look we can tell it is not the same quality and not to our surprise the flavor is not the same either.  The new product is mediocre, boring, and basically tasteless....total bummer and a big disappointment.  If you step it up & spice it up, we may be back but for 7 bucks a pound it better be made with kurobuta pork.  Too bad, it is so sad to see that another good ole Vegas establishment gone bad.  Adios to the good ole Siena that once was:(

TyRx10grqXqa5Pbd_ea3lA.text: This place is off in the corner of Renaissance Plaza.  It's a small little deli located inside an Italian grocery market.  I'm giving it an ok rating because I didn't experience the best tasting food at the time.  I got an Italian sandwich.  The bread was a bit big, and the bread was a bit stale like it should be with that type of bread, but it cut the roof of my mouth.  The sandwich wasn't anything great in particular.  The stuffed calamari didn't really smell right, and it was cold when I ate it.  I took it to school, but there wasn't a microwave around so I had to eat it like that.  Not sure if it was supposed to be like that anyways.  The food is an ok price.  The worker was very friendly, but when I asked what was good, the only response was that "it's all good."   Haha I understand that, but usually I need a bit more help than that.  I'm going to give it another try and hopefully my second time around will be a bit better.

EvO8b-4C9d9g_ERZooLdjg.text: went for wifes birthday, food was slow and over cooked, waitter was more interested in talking to friends than wait on us , they had 3 tables all night, no management or they dont care. very over priced for medium quality get a chef who knows how to make pasta not mush......very disappointed

kuy2uWxdNHCYurgmfCNtNQ.text: We were in last night as still looking for great Italian in Vegas.  This restaurant is very nice, food was good.  Nothing spectacular.  We went into the deli/bakery to grab a couple of macaroons.  They were VERY dry and could tell they had been sitting there for a few days.  Not overly impressed with this place as the management should ensure better quality, but will give it another try to see if this was just an off night.

nTUJGAlOgCtLaMNLcPaxtA.text: I didn't know I was in the mood for Italian until we got here! Keep in mind, this review is for the restaurant not the deli. From the moment we walked in & greeted by the Hostess, we were having fun! The Hostess was very warm, welcoming & funny. Our Server was quick, prompt & very pleasant. As for the food, the calamari was delicious, the lasagna was great! My Partner ordered the Surf & Turf, and he felt it was just ok however the Mushroom tortellini that came with it was delish! They have a great wine storage in the middle of the  restaurant that acts as a divider to the deli.

pujwzsWthDv7Rjz7IgabFQ.text: Excellent! I took a group to Sienna on Sahara. We had a wonderful waiter Pasquale. He took care of the whole table. The kitchen was a little slow but all the entrees were delicious. The deli and bakery are so nice. Many of my group had never been here and will certainly come again and again.

o6y-tky0qvD6Us7ZtTnz8A.text: I have been to Siena twice since they opened in the Lakes. I didn't know much about them and had no idea they had a location anywhere else in Las Vegas. So, I went with a frame of reference based on Italian restaurants and deli's I have eaten at back home in Texas. I took my fiance there for a nice Sunday lunch and at first I was bit intimidated by the atmosphere because it seemed a bit pretentious but once our waiter arrived, he put us at ease. They had different specials and they all sounded so tasty. We ended up getting 2 appetizers-The Burrata and the Buongustaio. I also got an entree -Penne alla Vodka- Prosciutto Sauteed with Vodka in a Creamy Tomato Sauce. I was stuffed beyond belief. My second visit to Siena was again on a Sunday but this time I went into the deli to order a sandwich. Well I ended up ordering The Sicilian Sub and Tomato, Basil, Mozzarella platter doused with olive oil. OMG! This is the food of the God's! Comfort food, but on a higher scale. I wish I could make this food at home but I'm pretty sure it wouldn't turn out the same. That is why I will defer to the experts at Siena. This classic Sicilian cuisine with a relaxed atmosphere and they treat you like you are sitting around the family table. Totally worth the money!

photos.caption: Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sicilian Sub
Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato,Mozzarella,Basil Platter
Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buongustaio

UwP9qIYApb-Dqjha2-UCVA.text: Giancarlo is nice man and an honorable man as well, unfortunately his female bar manager and bartenders are not. I use to sop there frequently for cocktails but not anymore. After I paid my bill with my credit card I left one afternoon and I checked my credit card statement on line. The female bar manager and bartenders continued to make many multiple  charges on my card, EVEN THOUGH I WAS NOT THERE. I printed a copy of the statement and took a my credit card charge receipt directly to Giancarlo and he took care of the issue immediately. I have notified Las Vegas Metro Police of the employees I believed were involved in credit card fraud and never went back. A very nice environment  and owner but beware of the employees. I wonder how many other people who do not check their credit card statements have been victims of the employees?

qH_w91n6_cZ4jbqvzc6mvQ.text: Went in today for dinner since it's national spaghetti day. I had plain old fashion spaghetti and meatballs and it was fantastic. The sauce is delicious and the meatballs were great.   I genuinely love this place.

uaodYVyWMleI69R6mpEBng.text: I went there for Happy Hour last week.  Good deal on the wine prices and I was happy to hear that they have Happy Hour drink prices all day on Sundays.  However, the inside bar is very limited on space.   They had an outside patio that is enclosed with a/c and the bar extends onto the patio but the furniture out there it mismatched and it has a feel of being a bit rundown on the patio.  I would like to back and hear the live music (no music during happy hour).   The happy hour bar snacks were pretty good but not outstanding.

GXoW4JhEtlQG-efgW0mkVg.text: We went early on Saturday  night, I had a taste for bouillabaisse. First, I ordered a calamari appetizer, it was hot but very tough.   When  the soup arrived, I was truly disappointed. The stock was poor, the calamari was tough, it was bland overall. The waiter did not ask how I liked my food. Overall, it was an experience I won't be repeating. What's the deal here? They want you to think this is a good restaurant and serve lousy food with indifferent service. Too bad, I loved the place over on the east side.

Jal2mjpUIMtaF9MFIqP5VQ.text: Great italian food great service been here before and will come again plus all my favorite deli meats right in the same place awesome delicious

cFdoSxdffm00r1GRn2-3OQ.text: Siena definitely has a great selection of food. My boyfriend and I always try to go during their happy hour, the menu is priced great! Although sometimes when sitting at the bar, the service isn't always as great as it could be. But love the food and the live music.

HwTISY74IgOl5zCjmPlweg.text: Hadn't been here in years - beautiful new decor ! Food much better too and good service . Wish lunch special prices were less and we would lunch there more !

XJQVvlWVfLri2KzU1M9lCA.text: This is an authentic Italian deli and restaurant. I'm married to an Italian beauty and she loved it so much we went back twice.

apR7IITCcDaavVN6YFwp-A.text: Took two good friends for a birthday celebration and they didn't disappoint. Our server (we're pretty sure it was Tom) was brilliant from the apps through the main course to the dessert. He had great suggestions, up sells, and was on top of beverages even after a party of 12 came in. Food was incredible and the portions were huge. We'll definitely be back for another evening.

Tws007ca7UMs0WqYla9fFQ.text: The restaurant was absolutely lovely to eat at. Both the quality of service and food was stupendous! I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for top quality and authentic cuisine.

jQF9Lv_umQgBqbXw-ZfRcg.text: We love Siena! They have a great selection of seafood specials, as well as traditional italian dishes. Their olive tapenade that comes with the bread is delicious. We ordered the striped Sea bass (branzino) which they clean and filet in front of you, and the seafood black risotto topped with lobster tail; both dishes were super fresh, light and tasty. I also recommend, the Layer Cake Primitivo from the Puglia region, if you like a full body wine. Giancarlo, Siena's owner, personally stopped by the table to make sure, everything was perfect. Service from Juanelle was also impeccable!

RIy_POE3d4iFaQPZ01Mmrg.text: Taste was okay, but preparation  and service very bad.  Pasta was clumped and could not separate.  Told waitress and she stated she would tell cook and offered to replace the noodles.  No way that would happen since the wait would likely be 20 minutes.  I simple ate the topping and left the noodles.  No sorry about the quality.   Better food at the Olive Garden.

SYQhNpivZlv0Uv0HwlwShw.text: The food is good. Their menu has lots of options. The cheese sampler is awesome. You can try a variety of Italian cheeses you may never have heard of, hard and soft. So good, much better than Brio and God forbid, Olive Garden.

P5R6nSKyy90SKqAqjwqT3Q.text: Nice selection of deli items, but would not recommend the breakfast service!  A side order was not delivered until after we finished the meal and it took some time to adjust the bill even though we were the only diners at the time

-oaGgJaYasvcJGMebwSYNA.text: So glad to of found the original Siena Deli, got a Italian sub sandwich,  kind of skimpy on the meet.... will go and try again, just to make sure!

G0g-x1O-Hf1KAK4pQh8urA.text: Everything was normal. Nothing to special. The only thing that stood out was the quick and attentive service.

t1A_DGa7qJNvZZnpDdNUNg.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.   I usually order a chopped salad to start. Get the smaller size or share the larger size because there is plenty. The meats and cheese they use in the salad come from their own deli next door. The salad is always fresh and tasty. A creature of habit, I usually order the linguini vongole for my entree. And it never disappoints. Lots of clams still in the shell and the linguini is excellent. My wife has tried a wider variety of things on the menu: rissoto, sausage and peppers, lasagna, and spaghetti bolognese. She has been pleased with all. My only complaint was the dessert we ordered to go. It was the non-flour chocolate cake. I'd describe it as a sliver. But we have had their creme brulee, and it was good.   The atmosphere is relaxing with lower lighting and darker wood. In the evenings, there is usually a singer in the large bar area. The music ranges from the '40's to the '90's.   All in all, we consistently enjoy a nice meal and relaxing atmosphere every time we dine here.

1ppQdooeQtbTqbU0U3xxKA.text: This review is for the restaurant! The decor is pleasant, very nice atmosphere and great service. We ordered the carpaccio which was very good, however, this one had horseradish which makes some bites a bit overwhelming. I ordered the pesce plate and it was horrible! The pieces of fish were lacking flavor. In addition, the fish was charred so i was not a big fan of the flavor. Even the vegetables were not very good! It's hard to write a review for a place that has nice ambiance and great customer service but the food was not up to par.

photos.caption: Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pesce
Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carpaccio

kkcdJG3oVcNTNo74WamyBg.text: I have been shopping at Sienna Deli when I moved here in the 80's. They were on Trop and Eastern then. The baker, Mike, made the best Italian breads. Now that Sienna moved across town everything has changed. The bread is more French than Italian (the crust makes the difference). We ordered their classic sub which is more like a lettuce sub now. There was no oil, vinegar or mustard on very dry bread. We also ordered cannolis that ended up smothered in a cheap, waxy chocolate syrup which completely ruined them. I tried scraping the chocolate syrup off but it was too sticky. I added my own oil, vinegar and mustard but only one slice of each meat was invisible to the amount of thick bread. What was once a staple in my household is now a distance memory. Not one of the original staff was there (family run business) so I assume they sold it to people who are not Italian.

C8uW9yMLBKigoduch4FCfQ.text: Stopped in for an early dinner/Happy hour in the lounge. We've been here before and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves as we did during this visit. The service was spectacular! Our server (Liliya) knew the wine list as well as the menu items. The Rigatoni Bolognese was fantastic/flavorful. The spaghetti and meatballs were delicious and plentiful. I'm not much for describing food but I know what I like and this was very good.   The lounge is very open and friendly with plenty of seating at and around the bar. The deli is fun to visit and have lunch with an attached wine room. The dining room is spacious and has a warm feel to it off of the kitchen.  This stand alone Trattoris and Deli (not in a strip mall) is well worth the visit as the food is interesting and the service top notch.

1bYDpWrTSljgt8Pt5ADgjg.text: Siena is sooo amazing! Atmosphere and decoration on the inside is beautiful! First you get a bread basket with olive tapenade which is sooo good. I ended up getting the fruitti de mare and it was absolutely amazing. The seafood was cooked perfectly, their sauce was delicious, and I believe they used fresh pasta too, and that just put it over the top! We also had this dessert, I can't remember what it's called but it's like an almond cake with white chocolate and that was reaaally good as well. Will be back!!

ywCAz2ZLPp6VuMjKI4Q-lw.text: Really good place for wine, cheese and meat trays.  We went for dinner.  Next time we will try the cheeses and meats.  Very good sauces with the stuffed ravioli.  Excellent customer service and very friendly owner.

photos.caption: Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cake with pistachio frosting, very good!
Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free bread to start

wsRSTCZc4PdJ9jlTJHK87Q.text: We were in town for Hubby's birthday weekend and his aunt took us to eat at this restaurant for lunch on a Saturday.  Loved the decor and the cute deli/market next door.  There were 6 of us and we were greeted warmly and seated promptly.  We started off with calamari and bread and tapanade.  I was told the bread is baked fresh daily onsite and I was not disappointed.  The tapandade was muah muah good.  I could not get enough of both!  I thought to myself if the bread and tapandade were that good enough to make me do my happy dance in my seat then the food must be amazing.  I was not disappointed!  Everything we ordered was delicious.  Especially the housemade sausage that came with Hubby's meal.  The staff was all very attentive and we never had to ask for anything.  Water and drinks were always filled.  Even the owners came by to ask how we were doing.  This place is a class act.  Highly recommended!

rKFNZJJ_vMHMaVGrOVMIqQ.text: Been a lot of time on the bar here in sienna deli but we went with some friends for a late dinner and what a surprise we had! The full menu was unbelievable, we started with cheese plate with Italian verity of cheese was great then calamari and an arugula salad. Save the best for last the branzino fish was unbelievable probably the best deal in town was so tasty. The live band on Friday was great and the service was supreme. Definitely will go back and recommend to go and try this place.

h7RRm8USuQFPYwRrlUDmMw.text: We went here for the Italian car show and also to try out the food. I was starving so we passed by the beautiful cars and ate first.   There's a casual deli area and a nicer dining area. A live band was playing. What caught my attention was the flyer for F1 which I'm crazy about. Ferrari, F1 and food...I was in a very happy place.  After the bread service with olives, we got 4 different cheeses (Fontina, Fontinella, Locatelli and Pecorino), gnocchi al pesto and lasagna. I wanted carboncino but they were out. We ordered the Pecorino with truffles but was given pecorino pepato instead. I knew there was nothing that tasted like truffles on that cheese plate we got.  Gnocchi al Pesto: I love gnocchi and pesto so it was an easy decision to get this. Huge serving and lots of sauce. We were using bread to get rid of the excess pesto. The gnocchi was tasty and soft and the sauce was quite good. I don't know of any other places in Vegas that has gnocchi in pesto. 4/5  Lasagna: Their version brings back great childhood memories when we'd go to this small restaurant that serves good lasagna after going to a funeral or the airport. Tasty. The outside was hot but the middle wasn't. 3.5/5  We ended our meal by admiring and taking pictures of cars at the parking lot. Ferrari, Lamborghini, Maserati, Alfa Romeo and few Fiats. Who needs dessert?

t0GjaUl8YNs5cOJTjPD-7w.text: It started good with their rusheta salad but when I had their spaghetti Bologna's I ate something that is weird like paper.  When the hostess looked she said it's a bay leaf and brought us back the remaining food. I don't think it's bay leaf because I know the taste of it. Overall experience at this restaurant is HORRIBLE. My first and last time eating at this place.

cJ45E9gqXp5zheV-6GUpKA.text: We went here for Valentines Day. The outside of this place looks very nice, once you walk in it has more of a "Cheap restaurant chain" feel to it. Once we sat down the first thing we noticed was this think white paper covering the table cloth. Almost like construction paper thick, I felt like I was back in grade school sitting in the lunch room. We had looked at the menu online before we went to make sure we knew what we wanted. They had a "special" Valentine's Day menu, on this menu everything was about $10 more than the menu they had online. They brought us out some bread and a spread, which was very good. We asked for some oil and cheese to go with it. They literally brought us an open bottle of olive oil and a plate of shredded cheese.... never seen anything like this before. I ended ordering the lasagna and my girlfriend ordered the tomahawk pork chop. The portions were pretty small, but the food was good. It this place worked a little more on presentation of itself and its staff it would have gotten a better review from me. Until then, I'll look for another Italian place to get me pasta fix.

Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CwlTuyXqEVEB5-_w4fgqaA.text: I'd visited this neighborhood establishment a few years ago to have drinks and had a good time. Fast forward my husband and I decided to have dinner/music at Siena a couple of weeks ago. Prior to going for dinner, I'd read a review that a customer experienced poor service that she felt was due to her party not ordering cocktails with dinner. I thought nothing of this review until we experienced the same. Upon our arrival to Siena (about 7:45pm/Saturday night) we were greeted by the bus boy immediately. Unfortunately the waitress arrived much later. We noticed she would disappear for long periods on this seemingly un-busy evening. After we ordered dinner (no cocktails) we became famished. It took over 50 minutes for our Shrimp dishes to prepare. We prepared to walkout however the food arrived at that very moment. Our plan was to have dinner then take in some cocktails/music at the bar afterwards. Despite the poor service we stuck with the plan and had martinis at the bar. The atmosphere (new decor) and the music were a nice touch but not enough to alleviate the poor dining experience. We won't be back. I should add that my husband NEVER complains. On this occasion he actually directed me to take the time to share our experience with others. Choose another Italian restaurant.

OmQh2nLNaSCMKjmtFTPegg.text: I attended the Italian Car show again. WOW !  Amazing Cars and Incredible Tasting Food. How's that for a 2 team Parlay ! The place was packed. Ferraris, Maseratis & Lamborghinis everywhere. Throw in purrfect weather and it was an Excellent afternoon.   1st class job by Siena as usual. Can't wait for next years Show. Grazie

photos.caption: Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Those are Diablos, for you non Raging Bull Fans.
Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Million $ LaFerrari.

xHKz-aqUCcdepulSnDZLIw.text: I'm perplexed by the Las Vegas Review-Journal readers who perpetually name the Olive Garden as Best Italian Restaurant, especially when there are so many better Italian restaurants in this city. And Siena is among the best I've been to.   My husband and I stopped in for an early dinner last night. Happy hour was in full swing in the bar, but we chose to sit in the restaurant. They have half-price bottles of wine on Tuesdays, so that was a bonus! We split a bottle of Sangiovese, which was also offered by the glass. And then we perused the menu, which offered the old classics along with a few modern twists.  Although we weren't too hungry, we couldn't pass up an appetizer of four meats brought over directly from the deli next door. We chose mortadella (fancy bologna), prosciutto (fancy ham), sopressata (fancy salami), and bresaola (fancy chipped beef). My husband is crazy about mortadella, and he said this one was great. I'm not a big fan of mortadella (although I did try a slice), but I really liked the other three meats, especially the bresaola. The meats were served on a long platter with a few olives as garnish. They also offer an assortment of cheeses this way; too bad they don't have a mix-and-match meat and cheese platter as an option. (I guess you could create one yourself, but I didn't see anything offering less than four choices, and four meats and four cheeses would have been a lot for just us two.)  For our entrees, I had the ravioli burro e salvia, which is cheese ravioli served on marinara and topped with a brown butter sage sauce. I liked this a lot, although I could have done without the marinara; the butter sauce was fine on its own. My husband got one of the daily specials: riblets with a side of pasta. An Italian restaurant is the last place I would expect to find riblets, but these certainly fit in with the Mediterranean-themed menu. They were lightly seasoned and grilled over the wood fire, and the pasta was nicely dressed with parm. Sides and salads were extra, and we had neither, although we didn't really need them because we both ended up taking home leftovers.  Our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable, and the food would make any True Italian proud. I can't wait to go back to the deli to pick up some bresaola (and some mortadella for the spouse), or maybe stop in for happy hour to try half-price apps and drinks. Now if we can only get some of those Olive Garden fans through the door!

tf2AE4RIqL7T7l2XpbqTmg.text: I was visiting friends in Summerlin who highly recommended the deli here for lunch.  The menus above the counter are extremely small, so bring your glasses if you're as near-sighted as I am. I let my friends order for me (I'm not joking - I literally couldn't read anything). They chose the Garden sandwich, which came out to just under $9 with tax.  We paid at the counter, and took our numbered placard to the outdoor seating area. Within 10 minutes, our food was whisked to our table by the waiter. One bite of my toasted, cheesey, melty, vegetarian sandwich and I was hooked. You could taste how fresh the ingredients were. You know this is a True Italian deli by the obvious care they put into feeding people.  The experience of dining al fresco was somewhat marred by the old guys smoking cigars at the next table. The breeze whipped the smoke right into our faces. Otherwise - buonissimo!

5YaUOok2t6VW4uDhjOXU8A.text: Was craving a sub and saw all the Sicilian sub pictures on here so I decided to give it a try.   Siena's is a nice restaurant with a deli attached to the side. I was really surprised by the selection of food at the deli. There was also gelato and lots of cold foods but I played it safe and went with the Sicilian. Cashier was was very friendly and the service was fast.   I would probably give this sub a 4/5. It was a delicious sub but I've had better. The bread was really good and it wasn't messy like other subs that I've had that are just prone to falling apart.   I just really love that there's a freaking deli attached to this restaurant! I was expecting the sandwich to be pricey but it wasn't bad ($7.50 including tax). This may be my new place to go when I get the munchies while studying at the Sahara library.

photos.caption: Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sicilian sub

rQbLg6LdX6K54PQJTBRg0w.text: Our first time here. Excellent service and delicious food. Will definitely come back! Most everything on their menu is homemade which always makes it better. Want to come back just for appetizers and desserts so we can try more things. Can't wait to eat here again and we haven't even left!

r8JQ6JCmS72dOHTFofFn0w.text: I have been to Siena several times.  They have a great happy hour menu in the bar.  Service has always been great, bartenders and servers alike very friendly and professional.

0U2XYW-kxBWwNXfEp0dV3g.text: Loved this place!! Prices are very reasonable, atmosphere is not stuffy, service was great, and the food was fantastic!!  We ordered 5 different pastas that everyone enjoyed. They were able to make a buffalo mozzarella with praschutto for me by request.  I finished the evening off with a very good cannolo. Bottom line is we WILL be back!!

IJ0gAZPqARq1Eby85xclSw.text: Good food.  Great Ambiance.  Poor Service ( I put up with it! )  Seems as if they never have experienced servers!  Do recommend however,  just expect okay service.

S7LmD-BctBAqWgVwreIOEg.text: Very disappointed........customer service is not available. Came for lunch. Ordered a bottle of wine, two soups and one main course, the bill was over $100 but greed took over and when I reviewed the e-mail receipt I saw they added a $2.00 split charge PER PERSON. Talk about going overboard. I guess if we had just asked for an extra plate there wouldn't be a split charge, but if they had to provide customer service then they need to charge for it. And, the bad thing also is that we were never advised. Greed does many things......including telling us not to return because their biggest attribute is GREED!

ZnL3UWFllk2l-5KhAAuLOg.text: $16 for 5 Raviolis! I can get a bag of them at Smiths for $4 and they taste better! Won't be seeing me again.....

3Tj1K07pywJA9_fe7QNX7Q.text: Stopped for dinner here after driving in from California. Felt like a good Pasta dinner and this place looked good. We got a chopped salad that was excellent and Lasagna which was super good and The Healthy Choice which was whole wheat angel hair pasta, with fresh tomatoes and sun dried in a marinara sauce that was also good, once it was replaced as they first brought out whole grain spaghetti and I was told they were out of the whole grain angel hair pasta so replaced it with whole grain spaghetti and I said no way I ordered angel hair pasta that is my favorite and after talking to the manager they replaced it with regular angel hair pasta which was ok. They comped us a dessert which helped. Definitely an older crowd and not to kid friendly.

TPGJRXe90PRHT1NAGrEuHA.text: First off, getting into the booth is a tight squeeze!! The table is very close..The menu was a bit difficult to read with no Pictures, and the names were a bit different. We also had to ask for olive oil and butter for the bread. I got the ham fettuccini Alfredo & it was undercooked , and our pizza was a bit soggy.

photos.caption: Photo of Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Undercooked ham fettuccini Alfredo

TH-e2k3uYi5AnRqut-hxdw.text: Some reviewers may not appreciate that good food is served in 'reasonable' quantities in classy restaurants and in Italy.  Apparently, some expect a trough-full of food!  This is as authentic as can be and the quality of the food is outstanding and the quantity appropriate!  Also, homemade pasta (and lasagne) have a different consistency than store-bought stuff; it's a mark of quality!  So, the lasagne may have a different consistency than what one may find in other so called Italian restaurants.  Siena's are very good.  The tiramisu is absolutely outstanding!!  The deli is a TREAT!  I never get tired of this place.  So, if a negative review is about the service, well, at times they are very, very busy (normally a very good sign about the quality of the restaurant!)  If the review is about the quality of the food, ignore it!  Obviously, the author doesn't know what good Italian fare really is!

BX9NXDVgVPW5Ff_E7MJirA.text: The staff and service are always top notch.  My favorites:  caprese salad, pizza and oh my the desserts are delicious!  There is a small deli store attached to the restaurant that is always well stocked and offers a nice selection of goods.  The ambiance is pleasant and there is a dividing wall between the bar area and the main table seating area.  It's casual yet can be a nice "date" location.

kjwBzaDUbilcPuBIhcAK9w.text: The quality of the food in the restaurant seems to have decreased.  Maybe this is just a momentary thing? Will again in a month or two. They have a wonderful deli

Qd08WT62tIKRndYkgOqC_w.text: The food and atmosphere are both great. Only downside is the price but sometimes you get what you pay for. We shared a pizza, the seafood pasta in cream sauce, and fried calamari. All three were awesome. The pizza was just right- not too heavy, calamari not too greasy, and pasta was delicious.   We will definitely be back.

wA9vNLjmYlLjomn6pf80gw.text: This review is for the bar area.  Dang, this place sure is pricey but tasty. If you want to enjoy the place without breaking the bank, order an appetizer and keep eating the free bread they offer.  I ended up ordering the shrimp scampi, but I wish I went with the meatball sliders. They looked much more filling. But in general, the appetizer portions are small.   That being said, the food is good and nicely presented. The service was pretty good, too. When I have more money to spare, I will definitely come back.

IeTZbvgJC3Bnb1KQCqJkAw.text: First timer, I found out about you on KSHP Radio, what a great meal. Peppercorn steak with mash potatoes and saute spinach, I'm not a huge spinach fan but I ate the whole serving. Great service, Great place to have dinner with your family. We will be back soon.

-it-aY8l7g50L5dq0-Zszg.text: Absolute nasty.....red headed waitress forgot my iced tea, free bread sucked, it wasn't fresh...i ordered some new soup they had NASTY...of all the years at eating at Italian restaurants this place is GROSE AND SERVICE SUCKS..

9Do6Kg_Y6fOHJWzhPVvq7A.text: We stopped to eat at the Deli before going to the movie.  Enjoyed a sausage and pepper sandwich and a cup of delicious gelato.

RtpXjTeacOIo3ZWlXgSz3w.text: A very nice itialian restaurant off the strip in Las Vegas. Two of us stopped for dinner with no reservations on a Tuesday evening around 7:00. No trouble getting a table.   The wine list had lots of recognizable choices but I picked an unknown Malbec. Good choice.   Started out with some bread and pesto spread. Both excellent.   I ordered Gnocchi in pesto sauce. The pasta was cooked properly and the sauce was tasty and was served at the right temperature.   Live music was playing in the bar and we could here it in the dining area. Good thing it was jazz!    Great place and well worth a visit.  Our waitress was very professional. Our water glasses were never past half empty, and she checked on us often.
